translated: By the continuity, it is said to be that itself.

analyzed: gshegs pa de dag gis bdag dang bdag gi rnam pa can gyi 'jig tshogs la lta bar 'gyur ro //
translated: Those Tathāgatas would have the view of the transitory collection in the form of self and mine.

translated: Bound by the tight fetters of attachment to self and mine, means that when there is the view of self and the view of mine, there is attachment to self and attachment to mine.

analyzed: de'i phyir 'dod chags 'ching ba yin pas /
translated: Therefore, since attachment is a fetter,

translated: Some apprehend the person, the Nirgranthas.

original: nas nga'o snyam pa'i phyin ci log yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: nas nga'o snyam pa'i phyin ci log yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Those who apprehend the self as a substance different from the aggregates, such as the tirthikas Kapila, Kanada, Akṣapāda, Kaṇāda, and so on, also have the fault that liberation is impossible, because they accept the basis of the pride of “I am” and because they have the error of thinking “I am.”

original: de'i phyir grol ba'i thabs yin pa'i phyir bdag med par lta ba kho na mdzes so //
analyzed: de'i phyir grol ba'i thabs yin pa'i phyir bdag med par lta ba kho na mdzes so //
translated: Therefore, the view of selflessness is beautiful, because it is the means of liberation.

original: mngon sum du mthong ba rnams la bdag tu nga rgyal ba ma byung ngo zhes bya ba 'di ni bzhad gad du bya ba zhig go //
analyzed: mngon sum du mthong ba rnams la bdag tu nga rgyal ba ma byung ngo zhes bya ba 'di ni bzhad gad du bya ba zhig go //
translated: It is ridiculous to say that the thought “I am” does not occur with regard to what is directly perceived.

analyzed: gang zhig the tshom gyi dpyad thag la myug pa nga'o snyam du sems la /
translated: It is credible that someone who is entangled in the net of doubt, thinking “I am,”

analyzed: mthong nas mi sems so zhes bya ba 'di ni dad par bya ba zhig go //
translated: would not think so when he sees.

analyzed: gzhan mu stegs byed kyi tshogs bdag tu lta ba dang / bdag la chags pa'i skud pa bsran tes sems btsems shing btsems pa ;
translated: The other groups of non-Buddhists, who are woven into the fabric of the world by the warp and woof of the view of self and the attachment to self,

analyzed: bsam gtan gyi bde ba la chags pa la blo gyen du 'thon pa thams cad kyis ni srid pa'i rtse mor 'dzeg pa'i sgor 'jug pa thob kyang nges par byed pa po yod pas thar pa'i sa bon gyi dri yang ma bsnams pa yin no //
translated: who are intent on the bliss of meditation, who have not smelled the fragrance of the seed of liberation, who have entered the path leading to the peak of existence,

analyzed: blo dang dbang po dang lus tsam po rkyen gyi gzhan gyi dbang mi rtag par mthong ba la ni bdag med pa'i 'du shes skye la /
translated: The idea of selflessness arises in one who sees the mind, the faculties, and the body as impermanent and as being under the control of other conditions.

original: de la de ltar goms par byas nas de nas rim gyis sems kyi rgyud ngar 'dzin pa dang gtan bral ba skye'o //
analyzed: de la de ltar goms par byas nas de nas rim gyis sems kyi rgyud ngar 'dzin pa dang gtan bral ba skye'o //
translated: Having become accustomed to that, then gradually the mind-stream becomes completely free of the conception of “I.”

analyzed: de nas gsal bar byas pa bdag gi dngos po la tshogs pa'i skabs med pa'i phyir yang skye ba med @311b pas thar bar 'thad do //
translated: Then, because the occasion for the collection of the parts of the self is destroyed, there is no arising, and so liberation is tenable.

original: de'i phyir thar pa'i tshul dang bral ba'i phyir dang / bdag tu rtog pa spang bar bya ba yin pa'i phyir na /
analyzed: de'i phyir thar pa'i tshul dang bral ba'i phyir dang / bdag tu rtog pa spang bar bya ba yin pa'i phyir na /
translated: Therefore, because it is devoid of the method of liberation and because the conception of self is to be abandoned,

original: nga rgyal ba 'di ni phyin ci log yin no //
analyzed: nga rgyal ba 'di ni phyin ci log yin no //
translated: this pride is a mistake.

analyzed: 'o na gal te bdag rnam pa thams cad du med pa ni ji ltar sems skad cig pa rnams zhes bya ba la sogs pa 'byung ngo//
translated: If the self does not exist in any way, how can there be the mind that is momentary?

original: de'i phyir skad cig ma'i phyogs yongs su 'dzin pa la dran pa dang ngo shes pa la sogs pa rnams mi skye bar smra bar nus so //
analyzed: de'i phyir skad cig ma'i phyogs yongs su 'dzin pa la dran pa dang ngo shes pa la sogs pa rnams mi skye bar smra bar nus so //
translated: Therefore, it is possible to say that memory, recognition, etc., do not arise in the case of one who holds the position of momentariness.

analyzed: gzugs la sogs pa skad cig ma snga ma la nyams su myong bar 'gyur ba ni skad cig ma phyi ma la dran pa srid par ji ltar 'gyur te /
translated: How can it be possible that the previous moment of form, etc., which was experienced, is remembered in the subsequent moment?

original: nag pa la sogs pas bde ba dang sdug bsngal dang cig shos su nyams su myong ba gang yin pa de ni de las ngo bo tha dad pa lus bkra ba la sogs pa'i dran pa'i lam du gzud par mi nus so zhe na /
analyzed: nag pa la sogs pas bde ba dang sdug bsngal dang cig shos su nyams su myong ba gang yin pa de ni de las ngo bo tha dad pa lus bkra ba la sogs pa'i dran pa'i lam du gzud par mi nus so zhe na /
translated: It is not possible to introduce the memory of the body, etc., which is a different entity from the experience of pleasure, pain, etc., as the object of memory.

original: dran pa'i yul la 'du shes pa'i rgyu las byung ba'i sems kyi khyad par las so zhes bya ba smos te /
analyzed: dran pa'i yul la 'du shes pa'i rgyu las byung ba'i sems kyi khyad par las so zhes bya ba smos te /
translated: The author of the commentary says, “It is from the special mind that arises from the cause of the discrimination of the object of memory.”

original: dran pa'i yul ni dran pa'i yul te /
analyzed: dran pa'i yul ni dran pa'i yul te /
translated: The object of memory is the object of memory.

original: nyams su myong ba'i don to //
analyzed: nyams su myong ba'i don to //
translated: It means the experienced object.

original: 'di la de la 'du shes pa'i rgyu /
analyzed: 'di la de la 'du shes pa'i rgyu /
translated: The cause of the discrimination of that is the cause of the discrimination of the object of memory.

original: rgyu mtshan yod pas na dran pa'i yul la 'du shes pa'i rgyu las byung ba'i sems kyi khyad par te /
analyzed: rgyu mtshan yod pas na dran pa'i yul la 'du shes pa'i rgyu las byung ba'i sems kyi khyad par te /
translated: Since there is a reason, it is a special mind that arises from the cause of the discrimination of the object of memory.

original: sems 'ga' kho na zhig yin gyi /
analyzed: sems 'ga' kho na zhig yin gyi /
translated: It is a certain mind,

original: thams cad ni ma yin no zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: thams cad ni ma yin no zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: but not all minds.

original: de las dran pa 'am ngo shes par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de las dran pa 'am ngo shes par 'gyur ro //
translated: From that, there is memory or recognition.

original: de ltar ga nyig khyad par bya ba dang / sems kyi khyad par ji lta bu las zhes 'dri ba la /🔽de la gtad pa dang zhes bya ba rgyas par smos so //
analyzed: de ltar ga nyig khyad par bya ba dang / sems kyi khyad par ji lta bu las zhes 'dri ba la / de la gtad pa dang zhes bya ba rgyas par smos so //
translated: Thus, it is asked, “What is the special object and what is the special mind from which there is memory?”🔽In response, it is said, “It is a special mind that arises from the cause of the discrimination of the object of memory.”

original: dran par bya ba de la gtad ba ni gtad pa'o //
analyzed: dran par bya ba de la gtad ba ni gtad pa'o //
translated: “Directed to that” means directed to the object of memory.

original: 'du shes la sogs pa dang ldan pa zhes bya ba'i sogs pa zhes bya ba'i sgras ni smon pas gzas pa dang goms pa la sogs pa bsdu'o //
analyzed: 'du shes la sogs pa dang ldan pa zhes bya ba'i sogs pa zhes bya ba'i sgras ni smon pas gzas pa dang goms pa la sogs pa bsdu'o //
translated: “Possessing discrimination and so on” means possessing aspiration, resolution, and so on.

original: 'dra ba mthong ba las ni dper na ba men dmigs nas ba lang dran pa dang / gzugs brnyan mthong ba las rtsa ba'i gzugs dran pa lta bu'o //
analyzed: 'dra ba mthong ba las ni dper na ba men dmigs nas ba lang dran pa dang / gzugs brnyan mthong ba las rtsa ba'i gzugs dran pa lta bu'o //
translated: From seeing a similar object, for example, one sees a gayal and remembers an ox, or one sees a reflection and remembers the original object.

original: 'brel ba can mthong ba las ni dper na me dang shing thog dang me tog gi kha dog mthong ba las tsha ba dang ro dang dri dag dang / rva mthong nas ba lang dang / du ba mthong ba las me dran pa de lta bu la sogs pa'o //🔽gang dag la rten gyi khyad par dang mya ngan dang rnam par g-yeng ba dang por yod pa ste /🔽rten gyi khyad par dang mya ngan dang @312a * //
analyzed: 'brel ba can mthong ba las ni dper na me dang shing thog dang me tog gi kha dog mthong ba las tsha ba dang ro dang dri dag dang / rva mthong nas ba lang dang / du ba mthong ba las me dran pa de lta bu la sogs pa'o // gang dag la rten gyi khyad par dang mya ngan dang rnam par g-yeng ba dang por yod pa ste / rten gyi khyad par dang mya ngan dang @312a * //
translated: The memory of a thing heard in association is, for example, the memory of the sound of a conch when the color of the conch is seen, or the memory of the taste of molasses when the smell of molasses is sensed.🔽The memory of a thing seen or heard in association with a particular support is, for example, the memory of a thing seen or heard in the company of someone.

original: rnam par g-yeng ba de dag gis mthu ma nyams pa can gyi sems kyi khyad par ro //
analyzed: rnam par g-yeng ba de dag gis mthu ma nyams pa can gyi sems kyi khyad par ro //
translated: The memory of a thing seen or heard in association with sorrow or distraction is, for example, the memory of a thing seen or heard when one is sorrowful or distracted.🔽The memory of a thing seen or heard in association with a particular state of mind is, for example, the memory of a thing seen or heard when one is in a particular state of mind, such as a happy or unhappy state.

original: de'i phyir sems kyi khyad par 'di lta bu las dran par 'gyur ro //🔽de la gtad pa las ni gal te de la gtod par byed na'o //
analyzed: de'i phyir sems kyi khyad par 'di lta bu las dran par 'gyur ro // de la gtad pa las ni gal te de la gtod par byed na'o //
translated: Therefore, memory arises from a particular state of mind.🔽The memory of a thing seen or heard in association with a particular object is, for example, the memory of a thing seen or heard when one is focused on it.

original: 'dra ba'i 'du shes la sogs pa dang ldan pa las ni gang la 'dra ba las dran pa 'byung ba'o //
analyzed: 'dra ba'i 'du shes la sogs pa dang ldan pa las ni gang la 'dra ba las dran pa 'byung ba'o //
translated: The memory of a thing seen or heard in association with a similar perception, etc., is, for example, the memory of a thing seen or heard when one has a similar perception, feeling, or conceptualization.

original: 'brel pa can gyi 'du shes dang ldan pa las ni gang la 'dra ba med kyang du ba la sogs pa mthong ba las dran par 'gyur ba'o //
analyzed: 'brel pa can gyi 'du shes dang ldan pa las ni gang la 'dra ba med kyang du ba la sogs pa mthong ba las dran par 'gyur ba'o //
translated: From the possession of a related idea, one remembers smoke, etc., even though there is no similarity, when one sees it.

original: smon pas gzas pa dang / goms pa la sogs pa dang ldan pa las ni gang la dus de'i tshe dran par bya'o snyam pa 'am /
analyzed: smon pas gzas pa dang / goms pa la sogs pa dang ldan pa las ni gang la dus de'i tshe dran par bya'o snyam pa 'am /
translated: From the possession of a vow, a resolution, and so on, one remembers at the time of the vow, thinking, “I will remember at that time.”

original: 'di da dran par bya ba la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: 'di da dran par bya ba la sogs pa'o //
translated: From the possession of habit, one remembers, thinking, “I will remember this.”

original: rten gyi khyad par la sogs pas zhes bya ba ni rten gyi khyad par nad kyi mtshan nyid dang / mya ngan dang / bya ba gzhan la g-yeng bas so //
analyzed: rten gyi khyad par la sogs pas zhes bya ba ni rten gyi khyad par nad kyi mtshan nyid dang / mya ngan dang / bya ba gzhan la g-yeng bas so //
translated: From the possession of a special basis, etc. means from the possession of a special basis, such as the characteristics of a disease, grief, or distraction by other activities.

original: sogs pa zhes bya ba'i sgras bsdus pas ni /
analyzed: sogs pa zhes bya ba'i sgras bsdus pas ni /
translated: The word “etc.” includes

original: las dang rig sngags la sogs pa dag gis so ;
analyzed: las dang rig sngags la sogs pa dag gis so ;
translated: karma, spells, and so on.

original: / de lta bu yin yang zhes bya ba rgyas par 'byung ba ni /
analyzed: / de lta bu yin yang zhes bya ba rgyas par 'byung ba ni /
translated: Even though it is like that, etc.

original: de la gtad pa zhes bya ba nas 'du shes la sogs pa dang ldan pa'o zhes bya ba'i bar dang / mthu ma nyams pa can gyi bar yin pas zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //🔽de'i rgyu las byung ba ma yin pa zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: de la gtad pa zhes bya ba nas 'du shes la sogs pa dang ldan pa'o zhes bya ba'i bar dang / mthu ma nyams pa can gyi bar yin pas zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go // de'i rgyu las byung ba ma yin pa zhes bya ba ni /
translated: The meaning of “not impaired” is up to “not impaired in its power.”

original: dran pa'i yul la 'du shes pa'i rgyu las ma byung ba zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: dran pa'i yul la 'du shes pa'i rgyu las ma byung ba zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: “Not arisen from that” means not arisen from the cause of the discernment of the object of memory.

original: bskyed pa zhes bya ba ni dbyung bar ro //
analyzed: bskyed pa zhes bya ba ni dbyung bar ro //
translated: “Generated” means produced.

original: gzhan lta bus zhes bya ba ni de la gtod pa ma yin pa nas 'du shes la sogs pa ldan pa ma yin pa dang / mthu nyams pa'i bar ro //🔽gzhan la zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: gzhan lta bus zhes bya ba ni de la gtod pa ma yin pa nas 'du shes la sogs pa ldan pa ma yin pa dang / mthu nyams pa'i bar ro // gzhan la zhes bya ba ni /
translated: “Like another” means not directed toward that, up to not endowed with discernment, etc., and impaired in its power.

original: sems kyi khyad par las gzhan la'o ;🔽/ ma yin te 'brel pa med pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: sems kyi khyad par las gzhan la'o ; / ma yin te 'brel pa med pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba ni /
translated: “Another” means other than the specific mind.

original: lha sbyin dang mchod sbyin gyi sems dag rgyu dang 'bras bu'i dngos po ma yin no zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: lha sbyin dang mchod sbyin gyi sems dag rgyu dang 'bras bu'i dngos po ma yin no zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: “No, because there is no connection,” means that the minds of Devadatta and Yajñadatta are not in the relation of cause and effect.

original: ji ltar rgyud gcig la yod pa'i sems dag rgyu dang 'bras bur gyur pa'i phyir 'brel pa ltar lha sbyin dang mchod sbyin gyi sems de dag de ltar 'brel pa ma yin pas 'dis ni dpe dang dngos gnyis mi 'dra ba nyid du ston to //
analyzed: ji ltar rgyud gcig la yod pa'i sems dag rgyu dang 'bras bur gyur pa'i phyir 'brel pa ltar lha sbyin dang mchod sbyin gyi sems de dag de ltar 'brel pa ma yin pas 'dis ni dpe dang dngos gnyis mi 'dra ba nyid du ston to //
translated: Just as the minds that exist in one continuum are related as cause and effect, the minds of Devadatta and Yajñadatta are not related in that way. This shows that the example and the thing exemplified are not similar.

original: 'dir smras pa /
analyzed: 'dir smras pa /
translated: Here the opponent says:

original: gzhan gyi mthong la de stobs skyed //🔽sems de dran par mi rigs zhes //
analyzed: gzhan gyi mthong la de stobs skyed // sems de dran par mi rigs zhes //
translated: The power of the other’s mind produces memory.

original: bya ba 'di la gnas sogs sems //
analyzed: bya ba 'di la gnas sogs sems //
translated: It is not reasonable to say that the mind remembers itself.🔽The mind that sees and the mind that remembers are the same.

original: dag ni dpe go ji ltar yin //
analyzed: dag ni dpe go ji ltar yin //
translated: How is this like the example?

original: gang phyir nag @312b sems kyis dran don //
analyzed: gang phyir nag @312b sems kyis dran don //
translated: The mind that sees is not the mind that remembers,

original: byams sems kyis dran min te dper //🔽sa bon de dang de min can //
analyzed: byams sems kyis dran min te dper // sa bon de dang de min can //
translated: just as the mind of love is not the mind of hatred.🔽The mind that sees is not the mind that remembers,

original: nyid kyis 'bras ljang las nas bzhin //
analyzed: nyid kyis 'bras ljang las nas bzhin //
translated: just as the seed of the green plant is not the seed of the rice plant.

original: sems gzhan gyis mthong la gzhan gyis dran no zhes kyang mi zer ro zhes bya ba ni gzhan 'ga' zhig gis dran pa ni ma yin no snyam du bsams pa'o //
analyzed: sems gzhan gyis mthong la gzhan gyis dran no zhes kyang mi zer ro zhes bya ba ni gzhan 'ga' zhig gis dran pa ni ma yin no snyam du bsams pa'o //
translated: We do not say that one mind sees and another mind remembers.

original: mthong ba'i las dran pa'i sems gzhan skye'o zhes bya ba ni rgyu yod pa'i phyir te /
analyzed: mthong ba'i las dran pa'i sems gzhan skye'o zhes bya ba ni rgyu yod pa'i phyir te /
translated: The mind that remembers the object seen arises from another mind.

original: sa bon yod pas myu gu bzhin no zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: sa bon yod pas myu gu bzhin no zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: This is because there is a cause, just as a sprout arises from a seed.

original: dran pa kho na las ngo shes pa yang yin no zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: dran pa kho na las ngo shes pa yang yin no zhes bya ba ni /
translated: Recognition also arises from memory alone.

original: dran pa yod na ngo shes te /
analyzed: dran pa yod na ngo shes te /
translated: Recognition exists when there is memory.

original: bdag gi mthong ba gang yin pa de nyid 'di yin no zhes bya bar dran pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: bdag gi mthong ba gang yin pa de nyid 'di yin no zhes bya bar dran pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because memory is the recollection that what was seen by me is just this.

original: 'o na gang zhes bya ba ni gal te sems kyi khyad par kho nas dran na 'o na gang nag pas dran no zhes bya de ji lta bu zhes bya ba'i tshig kho nas drang ngo //
analyzed: 'o na gang zhes bya ba ni gal te sems kyi khyad par kho nas dran na 'o na gang nag pas dran no zhes bya de ji lta bu zhes bya ba'i tshig kho nas drang ngo //
translated: If memory arises from a specific mind, then how is it that one says, I remember what was seen by Kṛṣṇa?🔽The phrase just that is to be supplied.

original: de yang zhes bya ba rgyas par 'byung ba ni nag pa zhes bya ba 'du byed kyi tshogs kyi rgyun de yang zhes bya ba de yang yul gzhan dang 'gyur ba 'byung ba ste /
analyzed: de yang zhes bya ba rgyas par 'byung ba ni nag pa zhes bya ba 'du byed kyi tshogs kyi rgyun de yang zhes bya ba de yang yul gzhan dang 'gyur ba 'byung ba ste /
translated: That continuum of the collection of formations called Kṛṣṇa also arises in another place and changes.

original: yul gzhan du 'byung ba dang 'gyur ba 'byung ba la rgyu'i dngos por yid la bsams nas so //
analyzed: yul gzhan du 'byung ba dang 'gyur ba 'byung ba la rgyu'i dngos por yid la bsams nas so //
translated: Having considered the cause in the arising of another object and in the arising of a transformation,

original: ci zhe na /
analyzed: ci zhe na /
translated: what is it?

original: rje bo zhes brjod par zad kyi gang zag ni ma yin te /
analyzed: rje bo zhes brjod par zad kyi gang zag ni ma yin te /
translated: It is the master, not the person, that is referred to.

original: tha snyad 'di ni rgyu dang 'bras bu'i dngos po la ltos pa yin gyi /
analyzed: tha snyad 'di ni rgyu dang 'bras bu'i dngos po la ltos pa yin gyi /
translated: This convention is based on the relation of cause and effect,

original: gang zag la ltos pa ni ma yin no snyam du bsams pa yin no //
analyzed: gang zag la ltos pa ni ma yin no snyam du bsams pa yin no //
translated: not on the person.

original: de nyid kyi phyir gcig pu ni 'ga' yang med ces bya ba la sogs pa smos so //
analyzed: de nyid kyi phyir gcig pu ni 'ga' yang med ces bya ba la sogs pa smos so //
translated: This is why he says, “there is no single entity whatsoever,” and so on.

original: de bzhin du su zhig gis rnam par shes pa zhes bya ba la sogs pa rgyas par 'byung ba ni /
analyzed: de bzhin du su zhig gis rnam par shes pa zhes bya ba la sogs pa rgyas par 'byung ba ni /
translated: Similarly, he says, “who is it that perceives?” and so on.

original: bdag med na su zhig gis de ltar rnam par shes /
analyzed: bdag med na su zhig gis de ltar rnam par shes /
translated: If there is no self, who is it that perceives in this way?

original: rnam par shes pa zhes bya ba'i don ci yin ;
analyzed: rnam par shes pa zhes bya ba'i don ci yin ;
translated: What is the meaning of the word “perceives”?

original: rnam par shes pas yul 'dzin pa'o //
analyzed: rnam par shes pas yul 'dzin pa'o //
translated: The object is grasped by consciousness.

original: ci de 'dzin pa rnam par shes pa las gzhan zhig yin nam /
analyzed: ci de 'dzin pa rnam par shes pa las gzhan zhig yin nam /
translated: Is the grasping of that object something other than consciousness?

original: 'o na ni rnam par byed do //
analyzed: 'o na ni rnam par byed do //
translated: Well then, it is consciousness that grasps.

original: gang gis de byed pa de bshad zin te /
analyzed: gang gis de byed pa de bshad zin te /
translated: It has been explained that it is consciousness that grasps.

original: rnam par shes pa'i rgyu ni ci rigs par dbang po dang don dang yid la byed pa la sogs pa dag yin no zhes bya ba 'di ni khyad par yin no //
analyzed: rnam par shes pa'i rgyu ni ci rigs par dbang po dang don dang yid la byed pa la sogs pa dag yin no zhes bya ba 'di ni khyad par yin no //
translated: The cause of consciousness is the sense faculty, object, mental attention, etc., as the case may be.

original: ci rigs par zhes bya ba ni ji ltar srid par ro //
analyzed: ci rigs par zhes bya ba ni ji ltar srid par ro //
translated: As the case may be means as is possible.

original: 'o na gang nag pas rnam par shes so zhes bya ba ji lta bu zhe na /
analyzed: 'o na gang nag pas rnam par shes so zhes bya ba ji lta bu zhe na /
translated: But how can it be said that Devadatta perceives, since Devadatta is a stream of aggregates?

original: nag pa zhes bya ba'i rgyud las de skye bar mthong nas smra bar zad do //
analyzed: nag pa zhes bya ba'i rgyud las de skye bar mthong nas smra bar zad do //
translated: Because Devadatta is seen as the cause of consciousness, it is said that Devadatta perceives.

original: drug pa 'di'i don ji lta bu yin /
analyzed: drug pa 'di'i don ji lta bu yin /
translated: What is the meaning of the sixth case, the genitive, in the statement, the eye consciousness of Devadatta?

original: rje bo'i don yin no //
analyzed: rje bo'i don yin no //
translated: It has the meaning of a master.

original: dper na gang gi jo bo gang yin pa @313a * //🔽zhes bya ba nas rgyas par rnam par shes pa gang du sbyar bar bya na 'di ltar 'di'i rje bo btsal /
analyzed: dper na gang gi jo bo gang yin pa @313a * // zhes bya ba nas rgyas par rnam par shes pa gang du sbyar bar bya na 'di ltar 'di'i rje bo btsal /
translated: For example, in the statement, the master of soandso,🔽the master is sought as the one who employs soandso.

original: rnam par shes par bya ba'i don la'o //
analyzed: rnam par shes par bya ba'i don la'o //
translated: The meaning of the genitive in the statement, the eye consciousness of form, is the object of consciousness.

original: ci'i phyir sbyar bar bya /
analyzed: ci'i phyir sbyar bar bya /
translated: Why is it employed?

original: rnam par shes par bya ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: rnam par shes par bya ba'i phyir ro //
translated: In order to make known the object of consciousness.

original: kye ma de nyid de'i don du sbyar ro zhes bya ba ni bsod nams kyis bskyed pa rnams kyis legs par smras so //🔽ji ltar sbyar bar bya ba bskyed pa'i sgo nas sam /

translated: “Oh, that is the meaning of that term,” is the correct explanation of those who are skilled in merit.

original: 'on te mngag pa'i sgo nas /
analyzed: 'on te mngag pa'i sgo nas /
translated: Is it that the master is the cause of the servant, or is it that the master is the instigator of the servant?

analyzed: rnam par shes pa la 'gro ba mi rung bas bskyed pa'i sgo nas so //
translated: Since it is not possible for consciousness to go, it is the cause of the servant.🔽In that case, the cause alone would be the master and the effect alone would be the servant.🔽The master is the cause of that which is produced from it, up to the master is the cause of that which is produced from it.🔽The master is the cause of that which is produced from it, up to the master is the cause of that which is produced from it.🔽The master is the cause of that which is produced from it, up to the master is the cause of that which is produced from it.

translated: The master is the cause of that which is produced from it, up to the master is the cause of that which is produced from it.🔽The master is the cause of that which is produced from it, up to

analyzed: su'i 'du shes yin zhes bya ba la sogs pa bsdu ste /
translated: The question “Whose perception is it?” is included in this.

original: 'di ni phyogs yin no //
analyzed: 'di ni phyogs yin no //

original: gang yang bya ba ni byed pa po la ltos pa'i phyir te zhes zer ba brda sprod pa po'o //
analyzed: gang yang bya ba ni byed pa po la ltos pa'i phyir te zhes zer ba brda sprod pa po'o //
translated: As for the statement “because the action depends on the agent,” the grammarians say:

original: de yang dgos so zhes bya ba ni rnam par shes pa po yang dgos so //
analyzed: de yang dgos so zhes bya ba ni rnam par shes pa po yang dgos so //
translated: “And that is necessary” means that the one who perceives is necessary.

original: gang zag go snyam du bsams pa yin no ;
analyzed: gang zag go snyam du bsams pa yin no ;
translated: The grammarians intend “the person.”

original: /'gro ba po'i 'gro ba'o zhes brjod pa yin no zhes bya ba ni dper na me 'gro'o //🔽sgra 'gro'o zhes me'i 'gro ba dang sgra'i 'gro ba ltar lhas byin 'gro'o //
analyzed: /'gro ba po'i 'gro ba'o zhes brjod pa yin no zhes bya ba ni dper na me 'gro'o // sgra 'gro'o zhes me'i 'gro ba dang sgra'i 'gro ba ltar lhas byin 'gro'o //
translated: As for the statement “it is said that the going is of the goer,” it is like saying “the fire goes” or “the sound goes.”

original: lhas byin 'gro ba'o zhes bya ba yang de dang 'dra ste /
analyzed: lhas byin 'gro ba'o zhes bya ba yang de dang 'dra ste /
translated: Just as there is the going of the fire and the going of the sound, so too it is said “Devadatta goes” and “the going of Devadatta.”

original: dpe 'dis ni lhas byin gyis rnam par shes so zhes bya ba grub po //
analyzed: dpe 'dis ni lhas byin gyis rnam par shes so zhes bya ba grub po //
translated: By this example, it is established that Devadatta perceives.

original: 'dra bar bdag nyid thob pa'i phyir zhes bya ba ni rgyu dang 'dra bar bdag nyid thob pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: 'dra bar bdag nyid thob pa'i phyir zhes bya ba ni rgyu dang 'dra bar bdag nyid thob pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because it obtains a nature similar to the cause.

original: cung zad kyang mi byed mod kyi zhes bya ba ni yongs su g-yo ba mi byed mod kyi zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: cung zad kyang mi byed mod kyi zhes bya ba ni yongs su g-yo ba mi byed mod kyi zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: “It does not do anything at all” means it does not move at all.

original: de'i rnam pa nyid do zhes bya ba ni sngon po la sogs pa yul gyi rnam pa nyid do zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: de'i rnam pa nyid do zhes bya ba ni sngon po la sogs pa yul gyi rnam pa nyid do zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: “It has the aspect of that” means it has the aspect of the object such as blue.

original: rnam par shes pa'i rgyur gyur pa'i phyir zhes bya ba ni rnam par shes pa yang rnam par shes pa gzhan gyi rgyu yin te /
analyzed: rnam par shes pa'i rgyur gyur pa'i phyir zhes bya ba ni rnam par shes pa yang rnam par shes pa gzhan gyi rgyu yin te /
translated: “Because it is the cause of consciousness” means that consciousness is also the cause of another consciousness.

original: de'i phyir rnam par shes pa gzhan skyed par byed pa la rnam par shes so zhes bya'o //🔽rgyu la byed pa po'i sgrar bstan pa'i phyir zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: de'i phyir rnam par shes pa gzhan skyed par byed pa la rnam par shes so zhes bya'o // rgyu la byed pa po'i sgrar bstan pa'i phyir zhes bya ba ni /
translated: Therefore, that which produces another consciousness is said to be consciousness.🔽“Because the term ‘agent’ is applied to the cause” means that the cause is considered to be the agent.

original: rgyu ni byed pa por 'gyur ba'i phyir dper na @313b dril bu ni sgrogs par byed pa'i rgyu yin pas dril bu sa sgrogs so zhes bya ba de dang 'dra'o //
analyzed: rgyu ni byed pa por 'gyur ba'i phyir dper na @313b dril bu ni sgrogs par byed pa'i rgyu yin pas dril bu sa sgrogs so zhes bya ba de dang 'dra'o //
translated: For example, a bell is the cause of sound, so it is said, “The bell rings.”

original: gcig kho na yin pa'i phyir sgron ma zhes bya ba ni me lce rnams kyi rgyun la nye bar 'dogs par byed la /
analyzed: gcig kho na yin pa'i phyir sgron ma zhes bya ba ni me lce rnams kyi rgyun la nye bar 'dogs par byed la /
translated: Because it is a single continuum, the term lamp is figuratively applied to the stream of flames.

original: de yul gzhan dag tu 'byung ba ste /
analyzed: de yul gzhan dag tu 'byung ba ste /
translated: That lamp arises in other places.

original: sgron ma rgyun gyi ngo bo de yul gzhan du byung ba la /
analyzed: sgron ma rgyun gyi ngo bo de yul gzhan du byung ba la /
translated: The stream of the lamp arises in other places.

original: yul de dang der 'gro ba zhes bya'o //
analyzed: yul de dang der 'gro ba zhes bya'o //
translated: It is said that it goes to those places.

original: de bzhin du gcig kho na yin pa'i phyir sems kyi rgyun la rnam par shes pa nye bar 'dogs par byed pa /
analyzed: de bzhin du gcig kho na yin pa'i phyir sems kyi rgyun la rnam par shes pa nye bar 'dogs par byed pa /
translated: In the same way, because it is a single continuum, the term consciousness is figuratively applied to the stream of minds.🔽That stream of consciousness arises in other places.

original: rnam par shes pa rgyun gyi ngo bo de yul gzhan dag la skye ba la yul de dang rnam par shes so zhes bya ba ste /
analyzed: rnam par shes pa rgyun gyi ngo bo de yul gzhan dag la skye ba la yul de dang rnam par shes so zhes bya ba ste /
translated: It is said that it perceives those places.

original: rnam par shes pa rgyun gyis skye bas rnam par shes so snyam du bsams pa yin no //
analyzed: rnam par shes pa rgyun gyis skye bas rnam par shes so snyam du bsams pa yin no //
translated: It is thought that consciousness perceives because the stream of consciousness arises.

original: yang ji ltar gzugs 'gyur ro zhes bya ba rgyas par 'byung ba ni /
analyzed: yang ji ltar gzugs 'gyur ro zhes bya ba rgyas par 'byung ba ni /
translated: Again, it is like the statement, “Form moves,” and so on.

original: ji ltar 'gyur ba po 'gyur ba la don gzhan ma yin pa dang / skyed pa po skye ba dang gnas pa po gnas pa las don gzhan ma yin pa ltar rnam par shes pa la yang de dang 'dra bar 'gyur te /
analyzed: ji ltar 'gyur ba po 'gyur ba la don gzhan ma yin pa dang / skyed pa po skye ba dang gnas pa po gnas pa las don gzhan ma yin pa ltar rnam par shes pa la yang de dang 'dra bar 'gyur te /
translated: Just as the one who changes is not a different object from the change, and the one who produces is not a different object from the production, and the one who abides is not a different object from the abiding, so it is with consciousness.

original: bya ba logs shig na med pa'i phyir /
analyzed: bya ba logs shig na med pa'i phyir /
translated: Because the action is not separate.

original: rnam par shes pa'i rnam par shes pa po yang rnam par shes pa'i bya ba las don gzhan ma yin pa nyid do //
analyzed: rnam par shes pa'i rnam par shes pa po yang rnam par shes pa'i bya ba las don gzhan ma yin pa nyid do //
translated: The one who is conscious of consciousness is not a different object from the action of consciousness.

original: bye brag ba'i gzhung lugs kyis bslus pas smras pa /
analyzed: bye brag ba'i gzhung lugs kyis bslus pas smras pa /
translated: The Vātsīputrīyas, deceived by their own scriptural system, say:

original: gal te bdag las rnam par shes pa mi skye na rnam par shes pa'i mtshan nyid kyi rgyu la khyad par med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: gal te bdag las rnam par shes pa mi skye na rnam par shes pa'i mtshan nyid kyi rgyu la khyad par med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: If consciousness does not arise from the self, then because there is no difference in the cause of the characteristics of consciousness,

original: rnam par shes pa de dang 'dra ba kho nar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: rnam par shes pa de dang 'dra ba kho nar 'gyur ro //
translated: consciousness would be exactly the same.

original: gal te bdag las skye na ni de'i bsam pa'i khyad par can kho na skye'o snyam du bsams pa yin no //
analyzed: gal te bdag las skye na ni de'i bsam pa'i khyad par can kho na skye'o snyam du bsams pa yin no //
translated: If it arises from the self, then only that which is distinguished by its intention arises.

original: myu gu dang sdong bu dang 'dab ma la sogs pa bzhin du rim pa nges par skye bar mi 'gyur zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: myu gu dang sdong bu dang 'dab ma la sogs pa bzhin du rim pa nges par skye bar mi 'gyur zhes bya ba ni /
translated: It is not that they arise in a fixed order, like a sprout, stem, leaves, and so on.

analyzed: ci'i phyir sems snga ma 'gags pas /

analyzed: myu gu las sdong bu kho na skye bar 'gyur gyi 'dab ma la sogs pa ma yin pa dang / sdong bu las 'dab ma kho na skye bar 'gyur gyi /
translated: Why is it that the mind of a cow arises after the mind of a woman,

translated: but not the mind of a horse?🔽Why is it that the mind of a cow arises after the mind of a woman,🔽but not the mind of a horse?🔽Why is it that the mind of a cow arises after the mind of a woman,🔽but not the mind of a horse?

analyzed: bdag nyid ces bya ba ni gzhan gyis ma btsal bar snyam du bsams pa yin no //
translated: “By itself” means without being sought by another.

analyzed: de ltar na 'dis ni ci'i phyir rtag tu de dang 'dra ba kho nar skyed par mi 'gyur zhes dris pa gang yin pa de'i lan btab pa yin no //
translated: Thus, he answers the question, “Why does it not always produce just that?”

translated: The order is not fixed.

translated: In order to show the question, he says:

analyzed: sems rnams kyi rim pa yang nges pa kho na ste zhes bya ba smos so //
translated: The order of the minds is also fixed.

analyzed: rigs kyi bye brag las zhes bya ba ni bsgom pa'i bye brag las so //
translated: “Due to the difference in type” means due to the difference in cultivation.
