analyzed: bud med kyi sems kyi mjug thogs su zhes rgyas par 'byung ba ni bud med kyi sems te bud med la dmigs pa'i mjug thogs su'o //
translated: “Immediately after a woman’s mind” and so on means immediately after a woman’s mind, that is, a mind that has a woman as its object.

original: bud med de'i lus ni de'i lus so //
analyzed: bud med de'i lus ni de'i lus so //
translated: The body of that woman is her body.

original: gal te kun du rgyu 'am /
analyzed: gal te kun du rgyu 'am /
translated: If a woman’s mind arises immediately after a man’s mind,

original: gzhan dge ba yang rung ba zhig de'i lus sun 'byin par byed pa'i sems sam /🔽de'i khyo 'am bu la sogs pa'i sems skyes pa ste /
analyzed: gzhan dge ba yang rung ba zhig de'i lus sun 'byin par byed pa'i sems sam / de'i khyo 'am bu la sogs pa'i sems skyes pa ste /
translated: Or else, the thought of the husband or son, etc. of the person who is the object of the thought of disgust for the body of the other person arises.

original: de'i khyo 'am bu la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: de'i khyo 'am bu la sogs pa'o //
translated: The thought of the husband or son, etc. of the other person.

original: sogs pa zhes bya ba'i sgras ni bu mo la sogs pa bsdu'o //
analyzed: sogs pa zhes bya ba'i sgras ni bu mo la sogs pa bsdu'o //
translated: The word “etc.” includes the thought of the daughter, etc.

original: de dag la dmigs pa'i sems ni de'i khyo dang bu la sogs pa la dmigs pa'i sems te /
analyzed: de dag la dmigs pa'i sems ni de'i khyo dang bu la sogs pa la dmigs pa'i sems te /
translated: The thought that has that as its object is the thought that has as its object the husband or son, etc. of the other person.

original: gal te de 'am gzhan zhig bud med kyi mjug thogs su skyes par 'gyur la /🔽yang phyis dus gzhan na rgyun yongs su 'gyur ba las bud med kyi sems skye na ;
analyzed: gal te de 'am gzhan zhig bud med kyi mjug thogs su skyes par 'gyur la / yang phyis dus gzhan na rgyun yongs su 'gyur ba las bud med kyi sems skye na ;
translated: If that person or another becomes a man after a woman,🔽and later, at another time, a thought of a woman arises from the transformation of the continuum,

original: bud med kyi sems phyis skyes pa de ni /
analyzed: bud med kyi sems phyis skyes pa de ni /
translated: that thought of a woman that arises later

original: de'i lus sun 'byin pa'i sems te /🔽bud med kyi lus sun 'byin pa'i sems bskyed pa la nus pa 'am /
analyzed: de'i lus sun 'byin pa'i sems te / bud med kyi lus sun 'byin pa'i sems bskyed pa la nus pa 'am /
translated: is the thought of disgust for the body of that person.🔽It is the thought that generates disgust for the body of a woman,

original: de'i khyo 'am bu la sogs pa'i sems bskyed pa la nus pa yin no //
analyzed: de'i khyo 'am bu la sogs pa'i sems bskyed pa la nus pa yin no //
translated: or the thought that generates disgust for the body of a man.

original: ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why is that?

original: de'i rigs can yin pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba smos so //
analyzed: de'i rigs can yin pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba smos so //
translated: Because it has that type.

original: 'di la de'i lus sun 'byin pa'i sems sam de'i khyo 'am bu la sogs pa'i sems rigs sam sa bon yod pas na de'i rigs can no //
analyzed: 'di la de'i lus sun 'byin pa'i sems sam de'i khyo 'am bu la sogs pa'i sems rigs sam sa bon yod pas na de'i rigs can no //
translated: Here, the mind that detests the body of a woman is of the same type as the mind of her husband or son, etc.

original: de'i dngos po ni de nyid de /
analyzed: de'i dngos po ni de nyid de /
translated: The state of that is that itself.

original: de dang rigs mthun pa'i phyir ro snyam du bsams pa yin no //
analyzed: de dang rigs mthun pa'i phyir ro snyam du bsams pa yin no //
translated: It is the same type, because it is similar to that.

original: gzhan du na ni zhes bya ba ni de'i rigs can ma yin pa'o //🔽yang na bud med kyi sems las rnam grangs kyis zhes bya ba rgyas par 'byung ba ni cig car ma yin par rnam grangs kyis bud med kyi sems las de'i lus sun 'byin par byed pa'i sems kyang skye la /
analyzed: gzhan du na ni zhes bya ba ni de'i rigs can ma yin pa'o // yang na bud med kyi sems las rnam grangs kyis zhes bya ba rgyas par 'byung ba ni cig car ma yin par rnam grangs kyis bud med kyi sems las de'i lus sun 'byin par byed pa'i sems kyang skye la /
translated: Otherwise, if it were not of the same type,🔽or else, from the mind of a woman, the mind that detests the body of a woman arises in turn,

original: de las de'i khyo'i sems dang de las de'i bu'i sems dang / de nyid las kyang sun 'byin pa la @314b sogs pa'i sems skye bar 'gyur na /
analyzed: de las de'i khyo'i sems dang de las de'i bu'i sems dang / de nyid las kyang sun 'byin pa la @314b sogs pa'i sems skye bar 'gyur na /
translated: from that, the mind of her husband, from that, the mind of her son, and from that, the mind that detests the body of a woman arises again.

original: de nas bud med kyi sems kyi mjug thogs su skyes pa'i sems rnams kyi nang nas rgyun gyis ches mang ba dang / nus pa'i sgo nas ches gsal ba dang / bskyed par bya ba'i sems dang nye ba gang yin pa'i sems de kho na skye bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de nas bud med kyi sems kyi mjug thogs su skyes pa'i sems rnams kyi nang nas rgyun gyis ches mang ba dang / nus pa'i sgo nas ches gsal ba dang / bskyed par bya ba'i sems dang nye ba gang yin pa'i sems de kho na skye bar 'gyur ro //
translated: Then, from among the minds of men that immediately follow a woman’s mind, only the mind that is most frequently repeated, that is most clear due to ability, and that is closest to the mind to be generated arises.🔽Because it is powerful due to the strength of its imprint.

original: de'i bsgos pa'i stobs dang ldan pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba ni ches mang ba 'am /
analyzed: de'i bsgos pa'i stobs dang ldan pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba ni ches mang ba 'am /
translated: That which is most frequently repeated,

original: ches gsal ba 'am /
analyzed: ches gsal ba 'am /
translated: that which is most clear,

original: ches nye ba de'i bsgom pa stobs dang ldan pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: ches nye ba de'i bsgom pa stobs dang ldan pa'i phyir ro //
translated: and that which is closest is powerful due to the strength of its cultivation.🔽The mind that is appropriate to the body at that time, etc.

original: de'i dus pa'i lus dang zhes bya ba rgyas par 'byung ba la de'i dus na nye bar gnas pa ni de'i dus pa ste /
analyzed: de'i dus pa'i lus dang zhes bya ba rgyas par 'byung ba la de'i dus na nye bar gnas pa ni de'i dus pa ste /
translated: Appropriate to that time means existing at that time.

original: lus kyi rkyen gyi khyad par ro //🔽ma gtogs pa ni bkol pa ste //
analyzed: lus kyi rkyen gyi khyad par ro // ma gtogs pa ni bkol pa ste //
translated: It is a special condition of the body.🔽Except for that, the mind that is appropriate to the body at that time arises.

original: gang la lus kyi phyi rol gyi rkyen dbyug pas bsnun pa la sogs pa nye bar gnas pa de nyid skye bar 'gyur bas so //
analyzed: gang la lus kyi phyi rol gyi rkyen dbyug pas bsnun pa la sogs pa nye bar gnas pa de nyid skye bar 'gyur bas so //
translated: The mind that is appropriate to the body at that time arises, because the mind that is appropriate to the body at that time arises when external conditions such as a blow from a stick are present.

original: bsgos pa de nyid ches stobs dang ldan zhes bya ba ni ches mang ba dang / ches gsal ba dang / ches nye ba'i dgos par bshad pa gang yin pa de ni stobs dang ldan pa yin na /
analyzed: bsgos pa de nyid ches stobs dang ldan zhes bya ba ni ches mang ba dang / ches gsal ba dang / ches nye ba'i dgos par bshad pa gang yin pa de ni stobs dang ldan pa yin na /
translated: That very conditioning is called “powerful” means “very strong,” “very clear,” and “very proximate.”

original: ci'i phyir 'bras bu mi 'byin zhe na /
analyzed: ci'i phyir 'bras bu mi 'byin zhe na /
translated: Why doesn’t it always produce its effect?

original: gnas pa gzhan du gyur pa nyid ni 'dus byas kyi mtshan nyid yin pa'i phyir zhes bya ba smos te /
analyzed: gnas pa gzhan du gyur pa nyid ni 'dus byas kyi mtshan nyid yin pa'i phyir zhes bya ba smos te /
translated: Because the characteristic of conditioned phenomena is transformation.

original: 'di'i mtshan nyid gnas pa las gzhan du 'gyur ba'i mtshan nyid do //
analyzed: 'di'i mtshan nyid gnas pa las gzhan du 'gyur ba'i mtshan nyid do //
translated: Its characteristic is transformation from the state of endurance.

original: de'i ngo bo'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de'i ngo bo'i phyir ro //
translated: Because it has that nature.

original: 'dus byas kyi mtshan nyid gzhan du 'gyur ba de yang dgos pa gzhan gyi 'bras bu skye ba'i rjes su mthun pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: 'dus byas kyi mtshan nyid gzhan du 'gyur ba de yang dgos pa gzhan gyi 'bras bu skye ba'i rjes su mthun pa'i phyir ro //
translated: That transformation of conditioned phenomena is also compatible with the arising of an effect that has a different purpose.

original: de'i phyir rtag tu 'bras bu de nyid mi 'byin to //
analyzed: de'i phyir rtag tu 'bras bu de nyid mi 'byin to //
translated: Therefore, it does not always produce that very same effect.

original: 'di skad du zhes bya ba ni gnas brtan sgra gcan zin gyis so //
analyzed: 'di skad du zhes bya ba ni gnas brtan sgra gcan zin gyis so //
translated: “In this way” refers to the elder Rāhula.

original: rnam pa thams cad ces bya ba ni rnam pa kun te rma bya'i mdongs 'di'i kha dog dang bkod pa la sogs pa'i rnam pa ji snyed pa de dag gis gang gi kha dog ni 'di lta bu'o //
analyzed: rnam pa thams cad ces bya ba ni rnam pa kun te rma bya'i mdongs 'di'i kha dog dang bkod pa la sogs pa'i rnam pa ji snyed pa de dag gis gang gi kha dog ni 'di lta bu'o //
translated: All aspects means all modes, for one cannot know the object of knowledge in the mode of, for example, the color and configuration of the peacock's eye.🔽One cannot know in the mode of, Its color is like this,

original: bkod pa ni 'di dang 'dra ba'o //
analyzed: bkod pa ni 'di dang 'dra ba'o //
translated: Its configuration is like this,

original: 'di ltar ni mtsher ro zhes bya ba de lta bu la sogs pa'i rnam par 'gyur ba'i shes bya shes par mi nus so //
analyzed: 'di ltar ni mtsher ro zhes bya ba de lta bu la sogs pa'i rnam par 'gyur ba'i shes bya shes par mi nus so //
translated: It is like this in its appearance.

original: su dag gis she na /
analyzed: su dag gis she na /
translated: Who cannot know?

original: thams cad mkhyen pa ma yin pa nyan thos dang rang sangs rgyas la sogs pas shes par mi nus so //
analyzed: thams cad mkhyen pa ma yin pa nyan thos dang rang sangs rgyas la sogs pas shes par mi nus so //
translated: Those who are not omniscient, such as sravakas and pratyekabuddhas.

original: de shes kun mkhyen stobs yin no //
analyzed: de shes kun mkhyen stobs yin no //
translated: The knowledge of that is the power of the Omniscient One.

original: zhes bya ba ni gang gis de'i rgyu shes pa'i byed pa snyam du bsams pa yin no //
analyzed: zhes bya ba ni gang gis de'i rgyu shes pa'i byed pa snyam du bsams pa yin no //
translated: This means that one cannot know the cause of that.

original: gzugs can ma yin pa'i sems kyi bye brag rnams lta smos kyang ci dgos zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: gzugs can ma yin pa'i sems kyi bye brag rnams lta smos kyang ci dgos zhes bya ba ni /
translated: What need is there to mention the specific states of the formless mind?

original: gzugs can rnams kyi rgyu yang shes par mi nus na /
analyzed: gzugs can rnams kyi rgyu yang shes par mi nus na /
translated: If one cannot know the cause of the material,

original: @315a * // gzugs can ma yin pa rnams kyi lta smos kyang ci dgos zhes bya pa'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: @315a * // gzugs can ma yin pa rnams kyi lta smos kyang ci dgos zhes bya pa'i tha tshig go //
translated: What need is there to mention those that are not physical?

original: mu stegs can gang la zhes bya ba ni bye brag pa'o //
analyzed: mu stegs can gang la zhes bya ba ni bye brag pa'o //
translated: “The tīrthikas” refers to the Vaiśeṣikas.

original: gal te yid dang phrad pa'i bye brag la ltos pa'i phyir ro zhe na /
analyzed: gal te yid dang phrad pa'i bye brag la ltos pa'i phyir ro zhe na /
translated: If you say that it is because it depends on the specific contact with the mind,

original: zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: zhes bya ba ni /
translated: then it is not so.

original: gal te sems skye ba ni bdag las skye bar 'dra mod kyi res 'ga' yid dang 'brel pa'i bye brag la ltos pa de'i phyir /
analyzed: gal te sems skye ba ni bdag las skye bar 'dra mod kyi res 'ga' yid dang 'brel pa'i bye brag la ltos pa de'i phyir /
translated: If you say that although the arising of the mind is similar to arising from itself, sometimes it depends on the specific contact with the mind,

original: sems rtag tu de dang 'dra ba kho nar skye bar mi 'gyur la /
analyzed: sems rtag tu de dang 'dra ba kho nar skye bar mi 'gyur la /
translated: then the mind would not always arise in exactly the same way.🔽And it would not arise in a fixed order, like a sprout, a stem, and leaves, and so on.

original: myu gu dang sdong bu dang 'dab ma la sogs pa bzhin du rim pa nges par yang skye bar mi 'gyur ro zhes bya bar 'dod na ni ma yin te 'brel pa gzhan ma yin pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba ni de ni de lta ma yin no
analyzed: myu gu dang sdong bu dang 'dab ma la sogs pa bzhin du rim pa nges par yang skye bar mi 'gyur ro zhes bya bar 'dod na ni ma yin te 'brel pa gzhan ma yin pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba ni de ni de lta ma yin no
translated: If you assert this, it is not so, because there is no other connection.

original: // ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: // ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why is that?

original: bdag dang yid de dag las 'brel ba gzhan du ma grub pa'i phyir te /
analyzed: bdag dang yid de dag las 'brel ba gzhan du ma grub pa'i phyir te /
translated: Because the self and the mind are not established as a different connection.

original: 'brel pa zhes bya ba'i dngos po gcig pu grub pa ni 'ga' yang med do //
analyzed: 'brel pa zhes bya ba'i dngos po gcig pu grub pa ni 'ga' yang med do //
translated: There is no single thing that is established as a connection.

original: 'dab chags par skyes pa'i ngo bo dag la phrad pa'i blor 'gyur te /
analyzed: 'dab chags par skyes pa'i ngo bo dag la phrad pa'i blor 'gyur te /
translated: The idea of contact arises in regard to things that are born in a cluster.

original: de dag ma bzung bar de'i blo med pa'i phyir la ;
analyzed: de dag ma bzung bar de'i blo med pa'i phyir la ;
translated: Because when they are not apprehended, that idea does not exist,

original: sgra bzhin dang / 'u shi bzhin dang / nam mkha'i bya'i phreng ba bzhin no zhes 'byung ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: sgra bzhin dang / 'u shi bzhin dang / nam mkha'i bya'i phreng ba bzhin no zhes 'byung ba'i phyir ro //
translated: like the idea of sound, a flock of birds, or a line of ants.🔽Even if that is established, the idea of contact does not exist in regard to things that are not born in a cluster, because they are not connected.

original: de grub kyang 'brel pa can dag ces bya ba rgyas par 'byung ba ni 'brel pa khas blangs kyang 'brel pa can 'jig rten na grags pa chu dang bum pa 'am /
analyzed: de grub kyang 'brel pa can dag ces bya ba rgyas par 'byung ba ni 'brel pa khas blangs kyang 'brel pa can 'jig rten na grags pa chu dang bum pa 'am /
translated: Even if you accept that there is a connection, the idea of contact does not exist in regard to things that are not connected, like water and a pot,

original: shing gnyis dang 'dra ba de dag ni yongs su chad pa'i phyir te /
analyzed: shing gnyis dang 'dra ba de dag ni yongs su chad pa'i phyir te /
translated: or like two trees, because they are not limited.

original: yul yongs su chad pa mthong ba'i phyir zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //🔽mtshan nyid rnam par bshad pa'i zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: yul yongs su chad pa mthong ba'i phyir zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go // mtshan nyid rnam par bshad pa'i zhes bya ba ni /
translated: Because they are seen to have limited objects.

original: bye brag pa'i gzhung lugs las phrad pa'i mtshan nyid bstan ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: bye brag pa'i gzhung lugs las phrad pa'i mtshan nyid bstan ba'i phyir ro //
translated: The idea of contact does not exist in regard to things that are not born in a cluster, because they are not connected.🔽The idea of contact does not exist in regard to things that are not connected, like water and a pot, or like two trees, because they are not limited.

original: phrad pa zhes bya ba'i mtshan nyid ni ma phrad pa sngon du 'gro ba can gyi phrad pa yin no zhes rnam par bshad pa'i phyir dper na lug gam gyad gnyis phan tshun 'thab pa 'am /
analyzed: phrad pa zhes bya ba'i mtshan nyid ni ma phrad pa sngon du 'gro ba can gyi phrad pa yin no zhes rnam par bshad pa'i phyir dper na lug gam gyad gnyis phan tshun 'thab pa 'am /
translated: For example, it is like two rams or two wrestlers who fight each other.🔽Or it is like a scarecrow and a crow.

original: dper na mtho yor dang bya rog bzhin gang na bdag yod pa de na yid med la gang na yod pa de ni bdag med do zhes /
analyzed: dper na mtho yor dang bya rog bzhin gang na bdag yod pa de na yid med la gang na yod pa de ni bdag med do zhes /
translated: Where there is a self, there is no mind, and where there is a mind, there is no self.

original: bdag yongs su chad pa ste yul yongs su chad pa nyid du thal bar 'gyur te /
analyzed: bdag yongs su chad pa ste yul yongs su chad pa nyid du thal bar 'gyur te /
translated: The self would be limited, that is, the object would be limited.

original: bdag yid dang phrad pa zhes bya ba 'dis ni phyogs 'di chos can gyi khyad par las bzlog pa bstan pa yin te /
analyzed: bdag yid dang phrad pa zhes bya ba 'dis ni phyogs 'di chos can gyi khyad par las bzlog pa bstan pa yin te /
translated: This statement “the self is in contact with the mind” indicates the reversal of the specific property of the subject.

original: chos can ni bdag go //🔽de'i khyad par ni thams cad yod pa nyid do //
analyzed: chos can ni bdag go // de'i khyad par ni thams cad yod pa nyid do //
translated: The subject is the self.🔽Its specific property is that it exists in all places.

original: de las bzlog ba ni thams cad med pa nyid do //
analyzed: de las bzlog ba ni thams cad med pa nyid do //
translated: The reversal of that is that it does not exist in all places.

original: de'i phyir yid 'phos pa las bdag 'phos par thal bar 'gyur zhes bya ba ni yid lus kyi phyogs gang dang gang du 'pho ba de dag de nas @315b bdag 'pho zhing 'dor ro zhes bya bar thal bar 'gyur te /
analyzed: de'i phyir yid 'phos pa las bdag 'phos par thal bar 'gyur zhes bya ba ni yid lus kyi phyogs gang dang gang du 'pho ba de dag de nas @315b bdag 'pho zhing 'dor ro zhes bya bar thal bar 'gyur te /
translated: Therefore, it follows that the self would migrate from one place to another, because the mind would migrate from one place to another.

original: dper na skyes bu sa'i phyogs gang dang gang du 'pho ba de nas nyi ma 'pho ba lta bu'o //
analyzed: dper na skyes bu sa'i phyogs gang dang gang du 'pho ba de nas nyi ma 'pho ba lta bu'o //
translated: For example, the sun migrates from one place on the earth to another.

original: de lta yin na yang 'di'i bya ba med pa nyid la gnod par 'gyur bas de nyid dam bcas pa'i nyes pa yin no //🔽nyams par zhes bya ba ni thal bar 'gyur ro zhes bya bar sbyar te /
analyzed: de lta yin na yang 'di'i bya ba med pa nyid la gnod par 'gyur bas de nyid dam bcas pa'i nyes pa yin no // nyams par zhes bya ba ni thal bar 'gyur ro zhes bya bar sbyar te /
translated: But if that were so, then the fault of the self’s inactivity would be incurred, and that is the fault of your thesis.

original: gang dang gang du yid 'pho ba der bdag 'jig pas de nyid 'dir dam bcas pa'i nyes pa yin te /
analyzed: gang dang gang du yid 'pho ba der bdag 'jig pas de nyid 'dir dam bcas pa'i nyes pa yin te /
translated: “It would be destroyed” means “it would follow that the self would be destroyed” in whatever place the mind migrates.

original: bdag rtag pa nyid log pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: bdag rtag pa nyid log pa'i phyir ro //
translated: That is the fault of your thesis, because the self would not be permanent.

original: gal te phyogs gcig phrad do zhe na zhes bya ba ni yid bdag gi phyogs gcig dang phrad pa 'am /
analyzed: gal te phyogs gcig phrad do zhe na zhes bya ba ni yid bdag gi phyogs gcig dang phrad pa 'am /
translated: If you say that only a part of the self comes in contact with the mind,

original: bdag yid kyi phyogs gcig dang phrad pa ste /
analyzed: bdag yid kyi phyogs gcig dang phrad pa ste /
translated: The mind is in contact with one part of the self.

original: lus kyi phyogs gang na yid gnas par gyur pa de na yod pa'i bdag gi phyogs dang ni yid mi phrad kyi glo nas phrad do //
analyzed: lus kyi phyogs gang na yid gnas par gyur pa de na yod pa'i bdag gi phyogs dang ni yid mi phrad kyi glo nas phrad do //
translated: The mind does not come into contact with the part of the self that is in the part of the body where the mind is located, but it comes into contact with the part of the self that is elsewhere.

original: de'i phyir phrad pa ni ma phrad pa sngon du 'gro ba nyid yin yang bdag gi phyogs ma phrad pa kho na yid dang phrad do zhes bya bar 'dod na /
analyzed: de'i phyir phrad pa ni ma phrad pa sngon du 'gro ba nyid yin yang bdag gi phyogs ma phrad pa kho na yid dang phrad do zhes bya bar 'dod na /
translated: Therefore, even though contact must precede noncontact, you assert that the part of the self that is not in contact with the mind comes into contact with the mind.

original: ma yin te de ni de nyid kyi phyogs yin pa nyid du mi rung ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: ma yin te de ni de nyid kyi phyogs yin pa nyid du mi rung ba'i phyir ro //
translated: That is not so, because it is not tenable that that part of the self is itself.

original: bdag la ni phyogs gzhan yod pa yang ma yin te /
analyzed: bdag la ni phyogs gzhan yod pa yang ma yin te /
translated: The self does not have another part,

original: cha med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: cha med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because it is partless.🔽Even if contact were to exist,

original: phrad pa yod du chug na yang zhes bya ba rgyas par 'byung ba ni phrad pa khas blangs su zin kyang /
analyzed: phrad pa yod du chug na yang zhes bya ba rgyas par 'byung ba ni phrad pa khas blangs su zin kyang /
translated: even if you accept that contact exists,

original: 'on kyang 'gyur ba med pa'i phyir yid rtag tu khyad par med pa la /
analyzed: 'on kyang 'gyur ba med pa'i phyir yid rtag tu khyad par med pa la /
translated: the mind would always be the same, without distinction, because the self is unchanging.

original: gang gis na 'di skad du yid dang phrad pa'i bye brag la ltos pa'i phyir ro zhes smras pa /
analyzed: gang gis na 'di skad du yid dang phrad pa'i bye brag la ltos pa'i phyir ro zhes smras pa /
translated: Why do you say this?

original: ji ltar phrad pa khyad par du 'gyur /
analyzed: ji ltar phrad pa khyad par du 'gyur /
translated: How could there be a difference in contact?🔽How could there be a difference in the mind?

original: ji ltar blo'i khyad par yin zhes de nyid la klan ka tshol bar byed do zhes bya ba ni ci'i phyir rtag tu de 'dra ba kho nar mi skye zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: ji ltar blo'i khyad par yin zhes de nyid la klan ka tshol bar byed do zhes bya ba ni ci'i phyir rtag tu de 'dra ba kho nar mi skye zhes bya ba'o //
translated: This is the same as asking, “Why don’t they always arise in the same way?”🔽If you say that the difference is due to the self’s own nature, which depends on a difference in the formative forces and the contact of the mind,

original: gal te 'du byed kyi khyad par la ltos pa'i bdag nyid dang yid phrad pa las so zhe na zhes bya ba ni gal te bdag dang yid ni rtag tu khyad par med mod kyi /
analyzed: gal te 'du byed kyi khyad par la ltos pa'i bdag nyid dang yid phrad pa las so zhe na zhes bya ba ni gal te bdag dang yid ni rtag tu khyad par med mod kyi /
translated: then if the self and the mind are always the same,

original: bdag dang yid sbyor ba 'du byed kyi khyad par la ltos pa nyid las blo'i khyad par 'dod na 'o //
analyzed: bdag dang yid sbyor ba 'du byed kyi khyad par la ltos pa nyid las blo'i khyad par 'dod na 'o //
translated: why do you claim that the difference in the mind is due to the difference in the formative forces that are the conjunction of the self and the mind?

original: 'di skad du bsgom pa'i khyad par gyi mtshan nyid kyi 'du byed kyi khyad par las bdag dang yid sbyor ba'i khyad par du 'gyur la /
analyzed: 'di skad du bsgom pa'i khyad par gyi mtshan nyid kyi 'du byed kyi khyad par las bdag dang yid sbyor ba'i khyad par du 'gyur la /
translated: In other words, the difference in the conjunction of the self and the mind is due to the difference in the formative forces, which are characterized by the difference in meditation.

original: de'i khyad par las blo'i khyad par du 'gyur ro zhes smras pa yin no ;
analyzed: de'i khyad par las blo'i khyad par du 'gyur ro zhes smras pa yin no ;
translated: and the difference in the mind is due to the difference in its cause.

original: / de'i phyir rgyu'i khyad par las 'bras bu'i khyad par du 'gyur te /
analyzed: / de'i phyir rgyu'i khyad par las 'bras bu'i khyad par du 'gyur te /
translated: Thus, the difference in the result is due to the difference in the cause,

original: dung dang rnga pa ta ha la sogs pa'i sgra bzhin no //
analyzed: dung dang rnga pa ta ha la sogs pa'i sgra bzhin no //
translated: like the sound of a conch and the sound of a paṭaha drum.

original: 'di ni yod pa ma yin no //
analyzed: 'di ni yod pa ma yin no //
translated: This is not so.

original: ga las she na /
analyzed: ga las she na /
translated: Why not?

original: sems kho na las zhes bya ba rgyas par smos te /
analyzed: sems kho na las zhes bya ba rgyas par smos te /
translated: The master says: “It is due to the mind alone, etc.”

original: 'dir slob dpon gyi dgongs pa ni sems kyang yod la /
analyzed: 'dir slob dpon gyi dgongs pa ni sems kyang yod la /
translated: The master’s intention here is this: The mind exists,

original: bsgom pa'i khyad par gyi mtshan nyid kyi 'du @316a * //
analyzed: bsgom pa'i khyad par gyi mtshan nyid kyi 'du @316a * //
translated: and the difference in the mind is due to the difference in the formative forces that have the nature of the cultivation of meditation.

original: byed kyi khyad par gang kho bo cag bag chags dang sa bon zhes bya bar rnam par 'jog pa yang yod pas kho bo dang khyod la rtsod pa med mod kyi /
analyzed: byed kyi khyad par gang kho bo cag bag chags dang sa bon zhes bya bar rnam par 'jog pa yang yod pas kho bo dang khyod la rtsod pa med mod kyi /
translated: We also posit that as imprints and seeds, so there is no dispute between you and me.

original: dngos po gzhan yin nam ma yin zhes bya ba tsam zhig khyad par yod do //
analyzed: dngos po gzhan yin nam ma yin zhes bya ba tsam zhig khyad par yod do //
translated: The difference is simply whether or not it is a different thing.

original: de'i phyir 'du byed kyi khyad par la ltos pa'i sems kho na blo'i khyad par du gyur la rag mod /
analyzed: de'i phyir 'du byed kyi khyad par la ltos pa'i sems kho na blo'i khyad par du gyur la rag mod /
translated: Therefore, it is certainly the case that the difference in the mind is due to the difference in the formative forces that are dependent on the mind.

original: bdag gam de dang phrad par brtags pas ci zhig tu bya snyam pa 'di yin no //
analyzed: bdag gam de dang phrad par brtags pas ci zhig tu bya snyam pa 'di yin no //
translated: What would be the point of imagining that it is the self or that it is in contact with the self?🔽The text says: “We do not see the slightest ability in the self.”

original: bdag gi nus pa 'di cung zad kyang mi dmigs so zhes bya ba rgyas par 'byung ba ni sman pa ngan g-yo can 'ga' zhig gis /
analyzed: bdag gi nus pa 'di cung zad kyang mi dmigs so zhes bya ba rgyas par 'byung ba ni sman pa ngan g-yo can 'ga' zhig gis /
translated: A certain deceitful physician

original: nad pa 'ga' zhig la sman byin nas bsams pa /
analyzed: nad pa 'ga' zhig la sman byin nas bsams pa /
translated: gave medicine to a certain patient and thought,

original: sman 'di ni rnyed sla ba yin te nad pa 'di 'khor dang bcas pas kyang shes so //
analyzed: sman 'di ni rnyed sla ba yin te nad pa 'di 'khor dang bcas pas kyang shes so //
translated: “This medicine is easy to obtain, and this patient and his retinue know about it.

original: sman 'dis kyang 'di'i nad zhi bar ni 'gyur ro //
analyzed: sman 'dis kyang 'di'i nad zhi bar ni 'gyur ro //
translated: This medicine will cure his illness.🔽Therefore, I will not obtain any wealth.”

original: de'i phyir bdag gis nor rnyed par mi 'gyur ro snyam du bsams nas /🔽phu sv'a h'a /🔽phu sv'a h'a /🔽zhes de la sngags kyis btab cing /
analyzed: de'i phyir bdag gis nor rnyed par mi 'gyur ro snyam du bsams nas / phu sv'a h'a / phu sv'a h'a / zhes de la sngags kyis btab cing /
translated: Thinking this,🔽he chanted the mantra over the medicine,

original: sngags 'dis na sman 'di grub po zhes skye bo la bstan na /
analyzed: sngags 'dis na sman 'di grub po zhes skye bo la bstan na /
translated: saying, “By this mantra, this medicine is effective.”🔽He then taught the people,🔽“This mantra makes this medicine effective.”

original: de la ji ltar sman gyis don grub par bya ba la sman ba ngan g-yo can gyis phu sv'a h'a zhes bya ba'i nus pa med kyi sman gyi nus pa yin pa de bzhin du blo'i khyad par skye bar bya ba la /
analyzed: de la ji ltar sman gyis don grub par bya ba la sman ba ngan g-yo can gyis phu sv'a h'a zhes bya ba'i nus pa med kyi sman gyi nus pa yin pa de bzhin du blo'i khyad par skye bar bya ba la /
translated: Just as a quack doctor's phe-swahā accomplishes the purpose of medicine, and is not the power of the medicine, so too, the self has no power to generate a special awareness.

original: bdag gis nus pa med kyi sems 'du byed dang bcas pa kho na'i nus pa yin no //
analyzed: bdag gis nus pa med kyi sems 'du byed dang bcas pa kho na'i nus pa yin no //
translated: The power is that of the mind and its formations alone.

original: gal te bdag yod na ni de gnyis srid do zhen ni zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: gal te bdag yod na ni de gnyis srid do zhen ni zhes bya ba ni /
translated: If the self exists, then these two are possible.

original: gal te bdag yod na 'du byed dang sems de gnyis srid pas de'i phyir bdag yod do zhes bya bar 'dod na /
analyzed: gal te bdag yod na 'du byed dang sems de gnyis srid pas de'i phyir bdag yod do zhes bya bar 'dod na /
translated: If you assert that the self exists because the two, the mind and its formations, are possible if the self exists,

original: 'dir smras pa /
analyzed: 'dir smras pa /
translated: then here you say,

original: tshig tsam du zad kyi 'di la rigs pa ni 'ga' yang med do //
analyzed: tshig tsam du zad kyi 'di la rigs pa ni 'ga' yang med do //
translated: This is mere words, but there is no logic at all here.

original: gal te de ni rten yin no zhe na zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: gal te de ni rten yin no zhe na zhes bya ba ni /
translated: If you say that it is the basis,

original: 'dir de gnyis rten yin no zhes bya bar 'dod na'o //
analyzed: 'dir de gnyis rten yin no zhes bya bar 'dod na'o //
translated: then here you assert that the two are the basis.

original: dper na gang gi brten pa lta bu zhes bya ba ni rten gyi ngo bor dper brjod pa tshol ba'o //
analyzed: dper na gang gi brten pa lta bu zhes bya ba ni rten gyi ngo bor dper brjod pa tshol ba'o //
translated: For example, like what is based on what? is a search for an example of the nature of the basis.

original: de la rten gyi don mi rigs par bstan pa'i phyir de dag kyang zhes bya ba rgyas par smos te /
analyzed: de la rten gyi don mi rigs par bstan pa'i phyir de dag kyang zhes bya ba rgyas par smos te /
translated: In order to demonstrate that the meaning of “basis” is illogical, he says, “Those formations and mind are not like a picture and a myrobalan fruit, etc.”

original: 'du byed dang sems de dag kyang ri mo dang / rgya shug la sogs pa ltar te /
analyzed: 'du byed dang sems de dag kyang ri mo dang / rgya shug la sogs pa ltar te /
translated: Those formations and mind are not like a picture and a myrobalan fruit, etc.

original: dper na rtsig pa la ri mo dang / gzhung bu la rgya shug brten pa ltar ro //
analyzed: dper na rtsig pa la ri mo dang / gzhung bu la rgya shug brten pa ltar ro //
translated: For example, a picture is based on a wall and a myrobalan fruit is based on a stalk, etc.

original: sogs pa zhes bya ba'i sgras ni snod dang zas la sogs pa bsdu ste /
analyzed: sogs pa zhes bya ba'i sgras ni snod dang zas la sogs pa bsdu ste /
translated: The term “etc.” includes a vessel and its contents.

original: 'du byed dang sems de dag ni rten dag la de ltar ma yin la /
analyzed: 'du byed dang sems de dag ni rten dag la de ltar ma yin la /
translated: Those formations and mind are not like that in relation to a basis.

original: de yang rtsig pa dang gzhung bu la sogs pa ltar rten du rigs pa ma yin no //🔽ci'i phyir zhe na thogs pa dang tha dad pa nyid kyis nyes bar thal bar 'gyur ba'i phyir ro zhes bya ba smos te /
analyzed: de yang rtsig pa dang gzhung bu la sogs pa ltar rten du rigs pa ma yin no // ci'i phyir zhe na thogs pa dang tha dad pa nyid kyis nyes bar thal bar 'gyur ba'i phyir ro zhes bya ba smos te /
translated: And that is not logical as a basis, like a wall, a stalk, etc.🔽Why? He says, “because the error of being obstructed and separate would ensue.”

original: thogs pa dag @316b bcas pa nyid kyis nyes pa nyid kyi phyir dang / yul tha dad pa nyid kyis nyes pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: thogs pa dag @316b bcas pa nyid kyis nyes pa nyid kyi phyir dang / yul tha dad pa nyid kyis nyes pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: The meaning is: because the error of being obstructed would ensue and because the error of being separate would ensue.

original: ji ltar gzhung bu dang rgya shug dag dang / rtsig pa dang ri mo dag rten dang brten pa'i ngo bo yin pas thogs pa dang bcas pa dang tha dad pa nyid du mthong ba ltar de dag kyang de ltar 'gyur ba zhig na /
analyzed: ji ltar gzhung bu dang rgya shug dag dang / rtsig pa dang ri mo dag rten dang brten pa'i ngo bo yin pas thogs pa dang bcas pa dang tha dad pa nyid du mthong ba ltar de dag kyang de ltar 'gyur ba zhig na /
translated: Just as a pot and myrobalan plums, and a wall and a picture, are seen to be obstructive and different because of the nature of the supported and the support, so also would be the case with the mind and mental factors.

original: 'di ni 'dod pa yang ma yin te /
analyzed: 'di ni 'dod pa yang ma yin te /
translated: But this is not accepted.

original: de'i phyir bdag ni rten ma yin no //
analyzed: de'i phyir bdag ni rten ma yin no //
translated: Therefore, the self is not the support.

original: dper na dri la sogs pa las sa gzhan ma yin pa ltar blo la sogs pa las kyang bdag gzhan ma yin no //
analyzed: dper na dri la sogs pa las sa gzhan ma yin pa ltar blo la sogs pa las kyang bdag gzhan ma yin no //
translated: Just as earth is not different from smell, etc., so the self is not different from the mind, etc.

original: skyes bu dam pa su zhig dri la sogs pa las sa gzhan ma yin pa nges par 'dzin par byed /
analyzed: skyes bu dam pa su zhig dri la sogs pa las sa gzhan ma yin pa nges par 'dzin par byed /
translated: What good person would apprehend that earth is not different from smell, etc.?

original: sa gang yin zhes smos na ji ltar gzugs dri la sogs pa dag las gzhan pa'o zhes bya ba lta bur gzugs dang dri dang ro dang reg bya dag las gzhan par ni bstan par mi nus so //
analyzed: sa gang yin zhes smos na ji ltar gzugs dri la sogs pa dag las gzhan pa'o zhes bya ba lta bur gzugs dang dri dang ro dang reg bya dag las gzhan par ni bstan par mi nus so //
translated: When it is asked, “What is earth?” it cannot be taught that it is different from form, smell, taste, and the tangible, as is the case with form, which is different from smell, etc.

original: gal te dri la sogs pa las sa gzhan ma yin na sa'i /
analyzed: gal te dri la sogs pa las sa gzhan ma yin na sa'i /
translated: If earth is not different from smell, etc., then earth🔽is not apprehended.

original: dri la sogs pa zhes bya ba tha snyad 'di ji ltar 'dogs te /
analyzed: dri la sogs pa zhes bya ba tha snyad 'di ji ltar 'dogs te /
translated: How can the conventions “smell of earth” and so on be posited?

original: nag pa'i sa zhes bya ba gzhan gyis gzhan tha snyad 'dogs par ni mthong ngo zhe na /
analyzed: nag pa'i sa zhes bya ba gzhan gyis gzhan tha snyad 'dogs par ni mthong ngo zhe na /
translated: We see that one thing is designated by another, as in “black soil.”

original: de'i phyir sa'i dri la sogs pa zhes bya ba'i tha snyad 'di zhes bya ba rgyas par smos so //
analyzed: de'i phyir sa'i dri la sogs pa zhes bya ba'i tha snyad 'di zhes bya ba rgyas par smos so //
translated: Therefore, the text says, “The convention ‘smell of earth’ and so on.”

original: khyad par du bya ba'i phyir ro zhes bya ba ni chu la sogs pa las khyad par du bya ba'i phyir zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: khyad par du bya ba'i phyir ro zhes bya ba ni chu la sogs pa las khyad par du bya ba'i phyir zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: The phrase “in order to distinguish” means “in order to distinguish it from water and so on.”

original: ji ltar zhe na /
analyzed: ji ltar zhe na /
translated: How is this done?

original: ci nas de dag nyid ces bya ba rgyas par 'byung bas ston par byed do //
analyzed: ci nas de dag nyid ces bya ba rgyas par 'byung bas ston par byed do //
translated: The text explains: “In order to indicate that it is only those that are the substance of earth.”

original: de dag nyid ces bya ba'i sgras ni de dag las ma gtogs pa'i sa'i rdzas bzlog pa'i phyir te /
analyzed: de dag nyid ces bya ba'i sgras ni de dag las ma gtogs pa'i sa'i rdzas bzlog pa'i phyir te /
translated: The word “only” in the phrase “only those” excludes any substance of earth that is not included among those.

original: ci nas dri la sogs pa de dag nyid do zhes bya bas zhes bya bar shes par 'gyur bar ro //
analyzed: ci nas dri la sogs pa de dag nyid do zhes bya bas zhes bya bar shes par 'gyur bar ro //
translated: The phrase “in order to indicate that it is only those that are the substance of earth” means in order to indicate that it is only those that are the substance of earth.

original: 'di nyid la dper brjod pa /
analyzed: 'di nyid la dper brjod pa /
translated: The text gives an example of this:

original: shing gi gzugs kyi lus bzhin no //
analyzed: shing gi gzugs kyi lus bzhin no //
translated: “Like the body of a wooden statue.”

original: zhes bya ba smos te ji ltar 'ji ba las byas pa la sogs pa gzhan las khyad par du bya ba'i phyir shing gi gzugs kyi lus zhes tha snyad 'dogs la /
analyzed: zhes bya ba smos te ji ltar 'ji ba las byas pa la sogs pa gzhan las khyad par du bya ba'i phyir shing gi gzugs kyi lus zhes tha snyad 'dogs la /
translated: Just as the body of a wooden statue is designated in order to distinguish it from other clay statues, etc.

original: shing gi gzugs kyi lus gzhan yang ma yin pa ltar 'di yang de bzhin du tha snyad 'dogs par 'gyur la /
analyzed: shing gi gzugs kyi lus gzhan yang ma yin pa ltar 'di yang de bzhin du tha snyad 'dogs par 'gyur la /
translated: and the body of a wooden statue is not different from the wooden statue, so too, designation occurs in this way.

original: dri la sogs pa las sa gzhan yang ma yin no //
analyzed: dri la sogs pa las sa gzhan yang ma yin no //
translated: And earth is not different from smell, etc.

original: 'du byed kyi khyad par la ltos su zin kyang zhes bya ba ni bdag dang yid phrad pa'o //
analyzed: 'du byed kyi khyad par la ltos su zin kyang zhes bya ba ni bdag dang yid phrad pa'o //
translated: Even though it depends on a particular formative force, i.e. the contact of self and mind,

original: gang zhig stobs che ba zhes bya ba 'du byed kyi khyad par te /
analyzed: gang zhig stobs che ba zhes bya ba 'du byed kyi khyad par te /
translated: that which is powerful is a particular formative force.

original: des 'du byed kyi khyad par gzhan dag la gegs byed do //
analyzed: des 'du byed kyi khyad par gzhan dag la gegs byed do //
translated: It obstructs other particular formative forces.

original: stobs che ba de nyid ci'i phyir rtag tu 'bras bu mi 'byin zhes bya ba ni slob dpon gyi tshig yin no //
analyzed: stobs che ba de nyid ci'i phyir rtag tu 'bras bu mi 'byin zhes bya ba ni slob dpon gyi tshig yin no //
translated: Why does that very powerful one not always produce its effect? This is the statement of the master.

original: de nyid kyi phyir yang bshad pa 'di'i tshul te 'du byed kyi tshul 'jig pa 'am /
analyzed: de nyid kyi phyir yang bshad pa 'di'i tshul te 'du byed kyi tshul 'jig pa 'am /
translated: Therefore, this is the method of explanation: the method of the destruction of formative forces.

original: @317a * // gegs byed pa gang yin pa de ni sa bon gyi bdag nyid kyis bsgos pa yin na /
analyzed: @317a * // gegs byed pa gang yin pa de ni sa bon gyi bdag nyid kyis bsgos pa yin na /
translated: If it is an obstruction, then it is infused with the nature of a seed.

original: bdag tu rtog pa ni don med cing dgos pa med pa yin te /
analyzed: bdag tu rtog pa ni don med cing dgos pa med pa yin te /
translated: But the conception of self is meaningless and purposeless.

original: 'du byed kyi don tu der brtag grang na 'du byed de'i bya ba gang yin pa de ni dgos pa kho na byed do //
analyzed: 'du byed kyi don tu der brtag grang na 'du byed de'i bya ba gang yin pa de ni dgos pa kho na byed do //
translated: If you imagine that it is for the sake of motivating formations, then whatever the activity of those formations, that alone is the purpose.

original: dran pa la sogs pa ni yon tan gyi dngos po yin pa'i phyir zhes bya ba rgyas par 'byung ba ni /
analyzed: dran pa la sogs pa ni yon tan gyi dngos po yin pa'i phyir zhes bya ba rgyas par 'byung ba ni /
translated: Because mindfulness, etc., are the entities of qualities, etc.

original: gal te dran pa 'du byed dang 'dod pa dang zhe sdang la sogs pa ni yon tan gyi dngos po yin pa'i phyir la /
analyzed: gal te dran pa 'du byed dang 'dod pa dang zhe sdang la sogs pa ni yon tan gyi dngos po yin pa'i phyir la /
translated: If mindfulness, formations, desire, hatred, etc., are the entities of qualities,

original: rdzas brten pa yon tan dang ldan pa ma yin no zhes de skad du mtshan nyid bstan pa'i phyir yon tan gyi rdzas de yang gdon mi za bar rdzas la brten pa yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: rdzas brten pa yon tan dang ldan pa ma yin no zhes de skad du mtshan nyid bstan pa'i phyir yon tan gyi rdzas de yang gdon mi za bar rdzas la brten pa yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: then that substance of qualities is certainly dependent on substance, because that is how the definition is taught.

original: de dag gi brten pa la sogs pa gzhan yod par yang rung ba ma yin no //
analyzed: de dag gi brten pa la sogs pa gzhan yod par yang rung ba ma yin no //
translated: It is not tenable that their dependence, etc., exist separately.

original: de bas na 'di dag gi rten gang yin pa de ni bdag yin pa de ni bdag yin pas de lta bas na bdag ni yod do zhes bya bar 'dod na /
analyzed: de bas na 'di dag gi rten gang yin pa de ni bdag yin pa de ni bdag yin pas de lta bas na bdag ni yod do zhes bya bar 'dod na /
translated: Therefore, since that which is the basis of these is the self, the self exists.🔽

original: de ni de lta ma yin no //
analyzed: de ni de lta ma yin no //
translated: Therefore, if you maintain that the self exists because it is the support of these, that is not so.

original: ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why is that?

original: dran pa la sogs pa yon tan gyi dngos po nyid du ma grub pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: dran pa la sogs pa yon tan gyi dngos po nyid du ma grub pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because memory and so on are not established as real entities of qualities.

original: yod pa thams cad rdzas yin zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: yod pa thams cad rdzas yin zhes bya ba ni /
translated: Everything that exists is substantial.

original: mtshan nyid kyi sgo nas yod pa gang yin pa de ni rdzas yin no //
analyzed: mtshan nyid kyi sgo nas yod pa gang yin pa de ni rdzas yin no //
translated: That which exists by way of its own characteristic is substantial.

original: dge sbyong gi 'bras bu ni rdzas drug yin no zhes 'byung ba'i phyir ro zhes bya ba de la /
analyzed: dge sbyong gi 'bras bu ni rdzas drug yin no zhes 'byung ba'i phyir ro zhes bya ba de la /
translated: Because it is said, “The fruit of the sramana is sixfold.”

original: zag pa med pa'i rnam par grol ba'i lam phung po lnga ni /
analyzed: zag pa med pa'i rnam par grol ba'i lam phung po lnga ni /
translated: The five aggregates of the uncontaminated liberated path

original: dge sbyong gi 'bras bu 'dus byas lnga yin la /
analyzed: dge sbyong gi 'bras bu 'dus byas lnga yin la /
translated: are the five conditioned fruits of the sramana.

original: bral ba ni dge sbyong gi 'bras bu 'dus ma byas yin te /
analyzed: bral ba ni dge sbyong gi 'bras bu 'dus ma byas yin te /
translated: Freedom is the unconditioned fruit of the sramana.

original: de ltar rdzas drug yin no //
analyzed: de ltar rdzas drug yin no //
translated: Thus there are six substances.

original: de dag rdzas la brten pa nyid du yang ma grub ste zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: de dag rdzas la brten pa nyid du yang ma grub ste zhes bya ba ni /
translated: They are not established as being the support of substance.

original: dran pa la sogs pa rnams rdzas la brten pa nyid du ma grub pa ste /
analyzed: dran pa la sogs pa rnams rdzas la brten pa nyid du ma grub pa ste /
translated: It is not established that memory and so on are based on substances,

original: gnyi ga la grub pa la chos kyi tha snyad 'dogs pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba'i tshul gyis so //
analyzed: gnyi ga la grub pa la chos kyi tha snyad 'dogs pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba'i tshul gyis so //
translated: because the convention of phenomena is imputed in both.

original: rten gyi don ni brtags zin to zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: rten gyi don ni brtags zin to zhes bya ba ni /
translated: The meaning of basis has already been investigated.

original: dper na gang gi rten gang lta bu'o //
analyzed: dper na gang gi rten gang lta bu'o //
translated: For example, what is the basis of what?

original: de dag kyang ri mo dang rgya shug la sogs pa lta bur brten pa ma yin la zhes bya ba rgyas par ro //
analyzed: de dag kyang ri mo dang rgya shug la sogs pa lta bur brten pa ma yin la zhes bya ba rgyas par ro //
translated: They are not based like a painting and a myrobalan fruit, and so on.

original: bdag med na ci'i phyir dge ba dang mi dge ba'i bya ba'i 'bras bu la sogs pa'i rtog pa yid la rgyu zhing 'gying bar 'gyur /
analyzed: bdag med na ci'i phyir dge ba dang mi dge ba'i bya ba'i 'bras bu la sogs pa'i rtog pa yid la rgyu zhing 'gying bar 'gyur /
translated: If there is no self, why does the thought of the result of virtuous and nonvirtuous actions and so on arise in the mind and persist?

original: skad cig ma zad pa nyid du khas blangs pa'i tshe las dang 'bras bu'i 'brel pa mi srid de /
analyzed: skad cig ma zad pa nyid du khas blangs pa'i tshe las dang 'bras bu'i 'brel pa mi srid de /
translated: When it is accepted that momentary states cease, the connection between actions and results is impossible.

original: gang gi phyir gzugs la sogs pa'i phung po bdag nyid kyi khyad par so sor nub cing /
analyzed: gang gi phyir gzugs la sogs pa'i phung po bdag nyid kyi khyad par so sor nub cing /
translated: Because the specific characteristics of the aggregates of form and so on disappear individually,

original: skad cig ma dang pos skye ba 'phangs pa rnams las ngo bo'i khyad par skad cig ma gzhan la rag lus pa'i bya ba 'bras bu skye ba mi rung ngo //
analyzed: skad cig ma dang pos skye ba 'phangs pa rnams las ngo bo'i khyad par skad cig ma gzhan la rag lus pa'i bya ba 'bras bu skye ba mi rung ngo //
translated: It is not tenable that the action of giving rise to the effect, the specific nature of those projected by the first moment of arising, depends on another moment.

original: de lta yin na yang lus bkra @317b sbyin pa la sogs pa'i bya ba'i 'bras bu mchod sbyin la sogs pas nyams su myong bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de lta yin na yang lus bkra @317b sbyin pa la sogs pa'i bya ba'i 'bras bu mchod sbyin la sogs pas nyams su myong bar 'gyur ro //
translated: Even though that is so, the effect of the action of giving, such as a body, is experienced by the sacrifice, and so on.

original: gang gi ltar na bdag yod pa de'i ltar na ni sems pa skyes pa'i bdag la chos sam chos ma yin pa gzhag nas 'gag la /
analyzed: gang gi ltar na bdag yod pa de'i ltar na ni sems pa skyes pa'i bdag la chos sam chos ma yin pa gzhag nas 'gag la /
translated: According to those for whom the self exists, the self that is the agent of the arising of intention is stopped by positing virtue or nonvirtue.

original: chos dang chos ma yin pa gzhan gyis zil gyis mnan pa de gnyis las dus gzhan gyi tshe 'bras bu 'byung bar rigs so zhe na /
analyzed: chos dang chos ma yin pa gzhan gyis zil gyis mnan pa de gnyis las dus gzhan gyi tshe 'bras bu 'byung bar rigs so zhe na /
translated: It is logical that the effect arises from those two at another time, since it is overwhelmed by other virtue and nonvirtue.

original: lha rnams dga' bas bsgos pa mi shes te /
analyzed: lha rnams dga' bas bsgos pa mi shes te /
translated: The gods do not know the dyeing of joy.

original: kho bo cag gi ltar na ni sems pa 'das pas sems da ltar sgo bar mi byed kyi /
analyzed: kho bo cag gi ltar na ni sems pa 'das pas sems da ltar sgo bar mi byed kyi /
translated: According to us, the past intention does not cause the present mind to engage in virtue.

original: 'on kyang sems snga ma dang lhan cig skyes pa'i sems pa'i khyad par las sems nus pas khyad par du byas pa skye la /
analyzed: 'on kyang sems snga ma dang lhan cig skyes pa'i sems pa'i khyad par las sems nus pas khyad par du byas pa skye la /
translated: However, a mind that is distinguished by the volition that arises simultaneously with the previous mind arises distinguished by the power of the mind.

original: de'i nus pa'i khyad par de ni gang las rgyud yongs su 'gyur ba'i khyad par las phyis 'bras bu skye ba bsgos pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: de'i nus pa'i khyad par de ni gang las rgyud yongs su 'gyur ba'i khyad par las phyis 'bras bu skye ba bsgos pa zhes bya'o //
translated: The distinction of its power is called “imprinted” because later the result arises from the distinction of the transformation of the continuum.

original: sems da ltar ba'i khyad par de yang de ma thag tu 'byung ba'i sems kyi nus pa'i khyad par gyis rgyur 'gyur ba na sems de sgo bar byed do zhes bya'o //
analyzed: sems da ltar ba'i khyad par de yang de ma thag tu 'byung ba'i sems kyi nus pa'i khyad par gyis rgyur 'gyur ba na sems de sgo bar byed do zhes bya'o //
translated: Also, the distinction of the present mind is the cause when it becomes the distinction of the power of the mind that arises immediately after it.

original: de'i phyir 'das pas sgo par mi byed la /🔽da ltar ba bsgo ba ma yin te /
analyzed: de'i phyir 'das pas sgo par mi byed la / da ltar ba bsgo ba ma yin te /
translated: Therefore, it is not the past that imprints.

original: de dag 'gags pa dang skye ba'i tshe de ma bsgos pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de dag 'gags pa dang skye ba'i tshe de ma bsgos pa'i phyir ro //
translated: The present is not imprinted because when it ceases and arises, it is not imprinted.

original: smras pa / sems gang zhig las las skye ba de'i rgyun las kyis bsgos pa la /
analyzed: smras pa / sems gang zhig las las skye ba de'i rgyun las kyis bsgos pa la /
translated: Objection: The mind that arises from karma is imprinted by karma on its continuum.

original: de 'bras skye phyir byas pa chud //
analyzed: de 'bras skye phyir byas pa chud //
translated: Since the result arises from that, the deed is not wasted.

original: za dang ma byas phrad pa bsal //
analyzed: za dang ma byas phrad pa bsal //
translated: The meeting of the experiencer with what was not done is eliminated.

original: rnam pa de dag zhes bya ba ni dkar sham la sogs pa'i rnam pa dag ces bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: rnam pa de dag zhes bya ba ni dkar sham la sogs pa'i rnam pa dag ces bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: The phrase “these aspects” means the aspects of white, etc.

original: des na phung po dag la bdag gi zhes bya ba yin par rtogs so //
analyzed: des na phung po dag la bdag gi zhes bya ba yin par rtogs so //
translated: Therefore, it is understood that the aggregates are called “mine.”

original: bdag la phan 'dogs pa'i lus la yang bdag nye bar 'dogs te zhes bya ba la sogs pa 'byung ngo //
analyzed: bdag la phan 'dogs pa'i lus la yang bdag nye bar 'dogs te zhes bya ba la sogs pa 'byung ngo //
translated: The body that benefits the self is also figuratively designated as the self.

original: phan 'dogs pa la bdag nye bar 'dogs pa yin yang bdag tu 'dzin pa ni ma yin no zhes bya ba ji ltar zhe na /
analyzed: phan 'dogs pa la bdag nye bar 'dogs pa yin yang bdag tu 'dzin pa ni ma yin no zhes bya ba ji ltar zhe na /
translated: Even though the body is figuratively designated as the self because it benefits the self, it is not the self.

original: 'di bdag go snyam du de ltar ni ma yin no //
analyzed: 'di bdag go snyam du de ltar ni ma yin no //
translated: It is not the case that the body is the self.

original: de nyid 'ongs pa yin no zhes bya ba ni drug pa 'di'i don ji lta bu yin /
analyzed: de nyid 'ongs pa yin no zhes bya ba ni drug pa 'di'i don ji lta bu yin /
translated: What is the meaning of the statement, “It is the same one who comes”?

original: jo bo'i don yin no //
analyzed: jo bo'i don yin no //
translated: It means the master.

original: dper na gang gi jo bo gang lta bu yin /
analyzed: dper na gang gi jo bo gang lta bu yin /
translated: What is the meaning of the statement, “It is as if it were the master”?

original: dper na ba'i nag pa lta bu yin no //
analyzed: dper na ba'i nag pa lta bu yin no //
translated: It is like a cow.

original: 'di ji ltar de'i jo bo yin /
analyzed: 'di ji ltar de'i jo bo yin /
translated: How is it the master of the cow?

original: de rmo ba dang bzho ba la sogs pa la sbyar ba de la rag lus pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de rmo ba dang bzho ba la sogs pa la sbyar ba de la rag lus pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because the cow is dependent on it for plowing, carrying, and so on.

original: bdag tu 'dzin pa gang du sbyar bar bya na /
analyzed: bdag tu 'dzin pa gang du sbyar bar bya na /
translated: Where is the self to be sought?

original: ji ltar 'di'i jo bo btsal /
analyzed: ji ltar 'di'i jo bo btsal /
translated: How is it the master of this?

original: bdag tu 'dzin par bya ba'i don la'o //
analyzed: bdag tu 'dzin par bya ba'i don la'o //
translated: It is to be sought in the object of self-grasping.

original: ci'i phyir sbyar bar bya /
analyzed: ci'i phyir sbyar bar bya /
translated: Why is it to be sought?

original: bdag tu 'dzin par bya ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: bdag tu 'dzin par bya ba'i phyir ro //
translated: Because it is the object of self-grasping.

original: kye ma de nyid de'i don du sbyar ro zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: kye ma de nyid de'i don du sbyar ro zhes bya ba ni /
translated: Alas, it is sought for that very purpose!

original: bsod nyams kyi skyed pa rnams kyi legs par smras so //
analyzed: bsod nyams kyi skyed pa rnams kyi legs par smras so //
translated: This is well said by those who are skilled in the cultivation of merit.

original: ji ltar sbyar bar bya /
analyzed: ji ltar sbyar bar bya /
translated: How is it to be sought?

original: @318a * // ci skyed pa'i sgo nas sam /🔽'on te mngags pa'i sgo nas /
analyzed: @318a * // ci skyed pa'i sgo nas sam / 'on te mngags pa'i sgo nas /
translated: Is it as a cause or as a result?

original: bdag tu 'dzin pa la 'gro ba mi rung bas bskyed par bya ba'i sgo nas so //
analyzed: bdag tu 'dzin pa la 'gro ba mi rung bas bskyed par bya ba'i sgo nas so //
translated: Since it is not suitable for the self to be a goer, it is to be sought as a cause.

original: de lta na ni rgyu kho na jo bo yin la /
analyzed: de lta na ni rgyu kho na jo bo yin la /
translated: In that case, only the cause would be the master,

original: 'bras bu kho na bran yin par 'gyur te /
analyzed: 'bras bu kho na bran yin par 'gyur te /
translated: and only the result would be the servant.

original: 'di ltar rgyu ni 'bras bu la dbang byed la /
analyzed: 'di ltar rgyu ni 'bras bu la dbang byed la /
translated: In this way, the cause has power over the result,

original: 'bras bu yang de dang ldan pa rgyu yin pas de ni bdag tu 'dzin pa'i rgyu gang yin ba de kho na'i yin no //
analyzed: 'bras bu yang de dang ldan pa rgyu yin pas de ni bdag tu 'dzin pa'i rgyu gang yin ba de kho na'i yin no //
translated: and the result is also the cause that possesses it. Therefore, it is only the cause of self-grasping that is the self.

original: shing ljon pa me tog chags so zhes bya ba dpe dang po ni grub pa'i mtha' gang la shing ljon pa yan lag can du mi 'dod pa de la yin te /
analyzed: shing ljon pa me tog chags so zhes bya ba dpe dang po ni grub pa'i mtha' gang la shing ljon pa yan lag can du mi 'dod pa de la yin te /
translated: The first example, “a tree has flowered,” is in regard to a philosophical theory according to which a tree is not accepted as having parts.

original: 'byung ba chen po ris mi mthun pa bzhis brtsams pa yin par mi 'dod pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: 'byung ba chen po ris mi mthun pa bzhis brtsams pa yin par mi 'dod pa'i phyir ro //
translated: This is because it is not accepted that a tree is composed of the four great elements of a different class.

original: gang la shing ljon pa yan lag can yod pa de la ni dpe gnyis pa nags tshal 'bras bu chags so zhes bya ba yin te /
analyzed: gang la shing ljon pa yan lag can yod pa de la ni dpe gnyis pa nags tshal 'bras bu chags so zhes bya ba yin te /
translated: The second example, “a forest has fruited,” is in regard to a philosophical theory according to which a tree has parts.

original: nags tshal zhes bya ba ni cung zad kyang med do //🔽ji ltar nags tshal shing s'a la dang t'a la tshogs pa gang la 'bras bu 'byung ba de dang 'bras bu chags so zhes bya ba de bzhin du skye mched drug gi mtshan nyid kyi rten gang la bde ba 'am sdug bsngal 'byung ba de la /
analyzed: nags tshal zhes bya ba ni cung zad kyang med do // ji ltar nags tshal shing s'a la dang t'a la tshogs pa gang la 'bras bu 'byung ba de dang 'bras bu chags so zhes bya ba de bzhin du skye mched drug gi mtshan nyid kyi rten gang la bde ba 'am sdug bsngal 'byung ba de la /
translated: There is no such thing as a forest at all.

original: bde ba 'am sdug bsngal ba zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: bde ba 'am sdug bsngal ba zhes bya ba'o //
translated: Just as it is said that a forest of śāla and tala trees has fruited when fruit appears on a collection of śāla and tala trees, so it is said that a person has pleasure or pain when pleasure or pain occurs in the basis that is characterized by the six sense spheres.

original: de ltar ni bshad do zhes bya ba ni //
analyzed: de ltar ni bshad do zhes bya ba ni //
translated: Thus it is explained.

original: de dag gyur pas gyur nyid phyir //
analyzed: de dag gyur pas gyur nyid phyir //
translated: Because they are the basis of the transformation,

original: rten ni mig la sogs pa yin no zhes skye mched drug ji ltar rten yin pa de ltar ni bshad zin to //
analyzed: rten ni mig la sogs pa yin no zhes skye mched drug ji ltar rten yin pa de ltar ni bshad zin to //
translated: The six sense spheres are the basis of the transformation of consciousness.

original: bdag med na las rnams kyi byed pa po ni gang yin /
analyzed: bdag med na las rnams kyi byed pa po ni gang yin /
translated: If there is no self, who is the agent of actions?

original: 'bras bu rnams kyi za ba po ni gang yin zhes bya ba 'byung ngo //
analyzed: 'bras bu rnams kyi za ba po ni gang yin zhes bya ba 'byung ngo //
translated: Who is the experiencer of the results of actions?

original: bshad pa gang gis na de byed pa po dang za ba po zhes bya bar rgyas par brjod par 'gyur ba ci las rnams sam /
analyzed: bshad pa gang gis na de byed pa po dang za ba po zhes bya bar rgyas par brjod par 'gyur ba ci las rnams sam /
translated: What is the basis of the designation of the self as the agent and experiencer?🔽Is it the self that is the basis of the designation of the self as the agent and experiencer?

original: 'bras bu nye bar longs spyod pa bdag la rag las sam /
analyzed: 'bras bu nye bar longs spyod pa bdag la rag las sam /
translated: Or is it the self that is the basis of the designation of the self as the experiencer of the results of actions?

original: de'i phyir rang dbang can gyi byed pa po 'am za ba po 'ga' yang med kyi /🔽rgyu dang 'bras bu tsam zhig yod na byed pa po 'am /
analyzed: de'i phyir rang dbang can gyi byed pa po 'am za ba po 'ga' yang med kyi / rgyu dang 'bras bu tsam zhig yod na byed pa po 'am /
translated: Therefore, there is no independent agent or experiencer at all.

original: za ba por 'dogs par zad de /
analyzed: za ba por 'dogs par zad de /
translated: When there is merely a cause and its result, the designation of agent and experiencer is made.

original: ji skad du /
analyzed: ji skad du /
translated: As it is said:

original: lus dang sems kyi rgyun gang las //
analyzed: lus dang sems kyi rgyun gang las //
translated: From the continuum of body and mind,

original: las dang de 'bras gnyis 'byung ba'i //
analyzed: las dang de 'bras gnyis 'byung ba'i //
translated: The two, action and its result, arise.

original: 'gro ba sna tshogs zhes bya ste //
analyzed: 'gro ba sna tshogs zhes bya ste //
translated: This is called the various reincarnating beings.

original: byed pa po dang za ba por brjod ces bshad pa lta bu'o //
analyzed: byed pa po dang za ba por brjod ces bshad pa lta bu'o //
translated: as it is said, “The self is said to be the agent and the experiencer.”

original: gal te byed pa po bdag yin na ni /
analyzed: gal te byed pa po bdag yin na ni /
translated: If the self is the agent,

original: de nyid bsgrub par bya ba yin te /
analyzed: de nyid bsgrub par bya ba yin te /
translated: then it is the object of the action of appropriation,

original: yod pa ma yin pa'i phyir dang / rtag pa'i phyir nam mkha' bzhin no //
analyzed: yod pa ma yin pa'i phyir dang / rtag pa'i phyir nam mkha' bzhin no //
translated: because it does not exist and because it is permanent, like space.

original: 'on te phung po lnga'i rgyun yin no zhe na ni /
analyzed: 'on te phung po lnga'i rgyun yin no zhe na ni /
translated: If the continuum of the five aggregates is the agent,

original: de nyid byed pa po yin te /🔽phung po lnga'i mtshan nyid de nyid byed pa po yin gyi bdag ni ma yin pas kho bo cag gi phyogs grub po //
analyzed: de nyid byed pa po yin te / phung po lnga'i mtshan nyid de nyid byed pa po yin gyi bdag ni ma yin pas kho bo cag gi phyogs grub po //
translated: then it is the object of the action of appropriation,🔽because the continuum of the five aggregates is the agent, not the self.

original: de la yang rang dbang med par bstan pa'i phyir te las ni rnam pa gsum ste zhes bya ba rgyas par smos so //🔽de la lus @318b dang ngag gi las dag ni sems kyi gzhan gyi dbang gis 'jug ste /🔽sems kyis rab tu bcug pa'i phyir ro ji skad du /
analyzed: de la yang rang dbang med par bstan pa'i phyir te las ni rnam pa gsum ste zhes bya ba rgyas par smos so // de la lus @318b dang ngag gi las dag ni sems kyi gzhan gyi dbang gis 'jug ste / sems kyis rab tu bcug pa'i phyir ro ji skad du /
translated: In order to show that the continuum of the five aggregates is also not independent, the root text states, “The three types of action are physical, verbal, and mental.”🔽Physical and verbal actions are dependent on the mind because they are activated by the mind.

original: des skyed lus dang ngag gi las //🔽zhes bshad pa lta bu'o //
analyzed: des skyed lus dang ngag gi las //🔽zhes bshad pa lta bu'o //
translated: As it is said, “The body and speech that are generated by the mind are the physical and verbal actions.”

original: sems kyang lus kyi gzhan gyi dbang gis 'jug ste /
analyzed: sems kyang lus kyi gzhan gyi dbang gis 'jug ste /
translated: Mind also operates under the control of something else, the body,

original: lus dang sems dag ni phan tshun rjes su byed pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: lus dang sems dag ni phan tshun rjes su byed pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because body and mind are mutually dependent.

original: rang gi rgyu'i gzhan gyi dbang gis kyang 'jug ste /
analyzed: rang gi rgyu'i gzhan gyi dbang gis kyang 'jug ste /
translated: It also operates under the control of its own cause,

original: yid dang chos yid la byed pa la sogs pa'i gzhan gyi dbang yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: yid dang chos yid la byed pa la sogs pa'i gzhan gyi dbang yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because it is controlled by such things as the mind, mental objects, and mental attention.

original: de yang de dang 'dra ba zhes bya ba ni sems kyi rang gi rgyu de yang rgyu gzhan gyi dbang gis 'jug pas lus sam /
analyzed: de yang de dang 'dra ba zhes bya ba ni sems kyi rang gi rgyu de yang rgyu gzhan gyi dbang gis 'jug pas lus sam /
translated: That cause of mind is also similar, because it operates under the control of another cause.

original: ngag gam sems sam rgyu gzhan yang rung gang la rang dbang med kyi /
analyzed: ngag gam sems sam rgyu gzhan yang rung gang la rang dbang med kyi /
translated: Thus, whether it is the body, speech, mind, or some other cause, nothing operates independently.

original: bzhi yis sems dang sems byung rnams //
analyzed: bzhi yis sems dang sems byung rnams //
translated: Mind and mental factors arise from four conditions.

original: gsum gyis snyoms par 'jug pa gnyis //
analyzed: gsum gyis snyoms par 'jug pa gnyis //
translated: The two meditative states arise from three.

original: gzhan ni gnyis po dag las skye //🔽dbang phyug sogs min rim sogs phyir //
analyzed: gzhan ni gnyis po dag las skye // dbang phyug sogs min rim sogs phyir //
translated: Other things arise from both.

original: zhes 'byung bas /
analyzed: zhes 'byung bas /
translated: They do not arise from God, because of sequence and so on.

original: dngos po thams cad ni rkyen gyi gzhan gyi dbang gis 'jug go //
analyzed: dngos po thams cad ni rkyen gyi gzhan gyi dbang gis 'jug go //
translated: Thus, all things operate under the control of other conditions.

original: bdag kyang ltos pa med par ni blo'i khyad par skye ba'i rgyu nyid du khas mi len pa'i phyir rang dbang can du mi 'grub bo //
analyzed: bdag kyang ltos pa med par ni blo'i khyad par skye ba'i rgyu nyid du khas mi len pa'i phyir rang dbang can du mi 'grub bo //
translated: because we do not accept that the self is the cause of the arising of a specific awareness without depending on other conditions, it is not established as independent.

original: ji ltar zhe na /
analyzed: ji ltar zhe na /
translated: How is that?

original: yid dang phrad pa la sogs pa'i khyad par la ltos pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: yid dang phrad pa la sogs pa'i khyad par la ltos pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because it depends on the specific contact of the mind and so on.

original: de lta bas na de lta bu mtshan nyid ces bya ba ni byed pa po rang dbang can no //
analyzed: de lta bas na de lta bu mtshan nyid ces bya ba ni byed pa po rang dbang can no //
translated: Therefore, the definition of that is an independent agent.

original: 'o na byed pa po ji lta bu zhe na /
analyzed: 'o na byed pa po ji lta bu zhe na /
translated: Well then, what kind of agent is it?

original: gang zhig gang gi rgyu'i gtso bo yin pa de ni byed pa po zhes bya zhes bya ba smos te /
analyzed: gang zhig gang gi rgyu'i gtso bo yin pa de ni byed pa po zhes bya zhes bya ba smos te /
translated: It is said, “That which is the primary cause of something is called the agent.”

original: gtsor de la brten nas skyes pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: gtsor de la brten nas skyes pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because it is primary, it is called the agent because it is produced in dependence on that.

original: de ni de lta bus yang byed pa por mi rung ngo zhes bya ba ni rgyu'i gtso bo'i ngo bor yang mi rung ngo zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: de ni de lta bus yang byed pa por mi rung ngo zhes bya ba ni rgyu'i gtso bo'i ngo bor yang mi rung ngo zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: It is said, “That is not suitable as an agent in that way,” meaning it is not suitable as the nature of the primary cause.

original: de'i rgyu ma yin par bstan pa'i phyir dran pa las ni 'dun pa skye'o zhes bya ba rgyas par smos te /
analyzed: de'i rgyu ma yin par bstan pa'i phyir dran pa las ni 'dun pa skye'o zhes bya ba rgyas par smos te /
translated: In order to demonstrate that it is not the cause of that, it is said, “Aspiration arises from recollection.”

original: dang po dran par bya ba'i don la dran pa skye'o //
analyzed: dang po dran par bya ba'i don la dran pa skye'o //
translated: First, memory arises with regard to the object to be remembered.

original: dran pa las ni 'dun pa ste /
analyzed: dran pa las ni 'dun pa ste /
translated: From memory, there is will,

original: byed 'dod pa yin no //
analyzed: byed 'dod pa yin no //
translated: which is the desire to act.

original: 'dun pa las ni rtog pa ste /
analyzed: 'dun pa las ni rtog pa ste /
translated: From will, there is intention,🔽which is the mental factor that directs the mind to an object.

original: bye brag tu smra ba rnams ni sems rtsing ba'i mtshan nyid do zhes zer ro //
analyzed: bye brag tu smra ba rnams ni sems rtsing ba'i mtshan nyid do zhes zer ro //
translated: The Vaibhāṣikas say that it is characterized by a coarse state of mind.

original: gzhan dag na re nges par rtog pa'i mtshan nyid shes rab kyi khyad par ro zhes zer ro //
analyzed: gzhan dag na re nges par rtog pa'i mtshan nyid shes rab kyi khyad par ro zhes zer ro //
translated: Others say that it is a special type of wisdom that is characterized by ascertainment.

original: rnam par rtog pa las rab tu dbang ba ste /
analyzed: rnam par rtog pa las rab tu dbang ba ste /
translated: From intention, there is aspiration,

original: brtson 'grus so //
analyzed: brtson 'grus so //
translated: which is the desire to act.🔽From aspiration, there is contact,

original: rab tu 'bad pa las rlung ngo //
analyzed: rab tu 'bad pa las rlung ngo //
translated: which is the mental factor that touches an object.🔽From contact, there is feeling,🔽which is the mental factor that experiences an object.🔽From feeling, there is craving,🔽which is the mental factor that desires an object.

original: rlung las ni las te /
analyzed: rlung las ni las te /
translated: From craving, there is grasping,🔽which is the mental factor that grasps an object.🔽From grasping, there is existence,🔽which is the mental factor that produces an object.🔽From existence, there is birth,

original: yul gzhan du 'byung ba'i mtshan nyid 'byung na /🔽'di la bdag gis ci zhig byed de /
analyzed: yul gzhan du 'byung ba'i mtshan nyid 'byung na / 'di la bdag gis ci zhig byed de /
translated: which is the mental factor that brings an object into existence.🔽From birth, there is aging and death,

original: de ni nus pa bkag pa yin no //🔽rnam par shes pa las nus pa bkag pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: de ni nus pa bkag pa yin no // rnam par shes pa las nus pa bkag pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba ni /
translated: which is the mental factor that causes an object to decay.🔽Thus, the twelve factors of dependent origination are established.

original: dmigs pa gang yin pa de ni rnam par shes pa yin na /
analyzed: dmigs pa gang yin pa de ni rnam par shes pa yin na /
translated: What is the purpose of this teaching?🔽It is taught in order to refute the self of persons and the self of phenomena.
