analyzed: 'du byed @319a * //
translated: The self of persons is refuted by the twelve factors of dependent origination.🔽The self of phenomena is refuted by the four truths.🔽The four truths are taught in order to refute the self of phenomena.🔽The four truths are taught in order to refute the self of phenomena.🔽The four truths are taught in order to refute the self of phenomena.🔽The four truths are taught in order to refute the self of phenomena.🔽The four truths are taught in order to refute the self of phenomena.🔽The four truths are taught in order to refute the self of phenomena.🔽The four truths are taught in order to refute the self of phenomena.🔽The four truths are taught in order to refute the self of phenomena.🔽The four truths are taught in order to refute the self of phenomena.🔽The four truths are taught in order to refute the self of phenomena.🔽The four truths are taught in order to refute the self of phenomena.🔽The four truths are taught in order to refute the self of phenomena.🔽The four truths are taught in order to refute the self of phenomena.🔽The four truths are

original: kyi khyad par la ltos pa'i sems kho na las yin par zad kyi /
analyzed: kyi khyad par la ltos pa'i sems kho na las yin par zad kyi /
translated: The mind alone is the cause of the difference, not the self.

original: bdag gi byed pa'i cung zad kyang mi dmigs te /🔽sman gyi 'bras bu grub pa la /
analyzed: bdag gi byed pa'i cung zad kyang mi dmigs te / sman gyi 'bras bu grub pa la /
translated: The self is not perceived to have the slightest activity.🔽It is like the case of a quack who says “phut svāhā” when he cures someone with medicine.

original: sman pa ngan g-yo can gyis phu sv'a h'a zhes smras pa dag bzhin no zhes rnam par shes pa la ni bdag gi nus pa bkag go //
analyzed: sman pa ngan g-yo can gyis phu sv'a h'a zhes smras pa dag bzhin no zhes rnam par shes pa la ni bdag gi nus pa bkag go //
translated: Thus the power of the self is refuted in regard to consciousness.

original: bdag med na ci'i phyir sems can gyi rten ma yin pa la yang sdig pa dang bsod nams nye bar sogs par ma gyur /
analyzed: bdag med na ci'i phyir sems can gyi rten ma yin pa la yang sdig pa dang bsod nams nye bar sogs par ma gyur /
translated: If there is no self, why is sin and merit not accumulated in what is not a living being?

original: bshad pa dbang po med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: bshad pa dbang po med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: The answer is: because it is devoid of faculties.

original: rgyu gang gis dbang po dang bcas pa'i lus mngon par bsgrub pa'i rgyu de sa dang rdo la sogs pa rnams med de /
analyzed: rgyu gang gis dbang po dang bcas pa'i lus mngon par bsgrub pa'i rgyu de sa dang rdo la sogs pa rnams med de /
translated: The cause by which a body with faculties is accomplished is not in earth, stone, etc.

original: de'i phyir dbang po dang bcas pa dag ma yin no //
analyzed: de'i phyir dbang po dang bcas pa dag ma yin no //
translated: Therefore, they are not endowed with faculties.

original: de nyid kyi phyir tshor ba'i rten ma yin pa'i phyir zhes bya ba smos te /
analyzed: de nyid kyi phyir tshor ba'i rten ma yin pa'i phyir zhes bya ba smos te /
translated: For that very reason, it is said that it is not the basis of feeling.

original: de'i rten skye mched drug yin no //
analyzed: de'i rten skye mched drug yin no //
translated: The basis of that is the six sense bases.

original: ji ltar yin pa de ltar ni bshad zin to zhes bya ba ni de dag gyur pas gyur nyid phyir /
analyzed: ji ltar yin pa de ltar ni bshad zin to zhes bya ba ni de dag gyur pas gyur nyid phyir /
translated: How this is so has already been explained.

original: rten ni mig la sogs pa yin no zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: rten ni mig la sogs pa yin no zhes bya ba'o //
translated: The basis is the eye, etc.

original: de la rten pa brten pa zhes bya ba ni bdag la brten pa'o //
analyzed: de la rten pa brten pa zhes bya ba ni bdag la brten pa'o //
translated: The dependent is so called because it depends on the self.

original: tshig gi lugs 'di ni lan btab zin to zhes bya ba ni gang gi rten gang lta bu /🔽de dag kyang ri mo dang rgya shug la sogs pa lta bur brten pa ma yin la /
analyzed: tshig gi lugs 'di ni lan btab zin to zhes bya ba ni gang gi rten gang lta bu / de dag kyang ri mo dang rgya shug la sogs pa lta bur brten pa ma yin la /
translated: This mode of expression has already been refuted.🔽They are not dependent like a picture and a fruit, etc.

original: rtsig pa dang gzhung bu la sogs pa ltar rten du rigs pa ma yin te /
analyzed: rtsig pa dang gzhung bu la sogs pa ltar rten du rigs pa ma yin te /
translated: Nor is it reasonable that they are the basis like a wall and a pillar, etc.

original: thogs pa dang tha dad pa nyid kyis nyes par 'gyur ba'i phyir ro zhes bya ba yin no //
analyzed: thogs pa dang tha dad pa nyid kyis nyes par 'gyur ba'i phyir ro zhes bya ba yin no //
translated: Because the faults of obstruction and difference would follow.

original: des skyed pa zhes bya ba ni sa bon des nus pa bskyed ces bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: des skyed pa zhes bya ba ni sa bon des nus pa bskyed ces bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: Generated by it means produced by the potency of that seed.

original: ji skad du bshad pa lta bu'o zhes bya ba ni gnas brtan sgra gcan zin gyis so //
analyzed: ji skad du bshad pa lta bu'o zhes bya ba ni gnas brtan sgra gcan zin gyis so //
translated: Just as it has been explained means as the elder Rahula has explained.

original: nye ba gang dang goms pa gang //
analyzed: nye ba gang dang goms pa gang //
translated: What is proximate and what is habitual?

original: zhes bya ba rgyas par 'byung ba ni /
analyzed: zhes bya ba rgyas par 'byung ba ni /
translated: The four types of karma are heavy, near, habitual, and previously done.

original: rgyu gcig la las bzhi po lci ba dang nye ba dang / goms pa dang / sngon byas pa yod pa bzhi po de dag gi nang na las lci ba snga ma yin pa de ni gsum bas sngar smin no //
analyzed: rgyu gcig la las bzhi po lci ba dang nye ba dang / goms pa dang / sngon byas pa yod pa bzhi po de dag gi nang na las lci ba snga ma yin pa de ni gsum bas sngar smin no //
translated: Among these four, the first, heavy karma, ripens first, before the other three.🔽Near karma and habitual karma ripen before previously done karma.

original: nye ba dang goms pa dang skye ba sngar byas pa rnams kyi yang nye ba snga ma yin pas de gnyis pas sngar smin no //
analyzed: nye ba dang goms pa dang skye ba sngar byas pa rnams kyi yang nye ba snga ma yin pas de gnyis pas sngar smin no //
translated: Among these three, near karma ripens first, because it is near.

original: goms pa dang sngar byas pa dag la yang goms pa snga ma yin pas gcig pas sngar smin no //
analyzed: goms pa dang sngar byas pa dag la yang goms pa snga ma yin pas gcig pas sngar smin no //
translated: Among habitual karma and previously done karma, habitual karma ripens first, because it is stronger.

original: de dag med na tshe snga ma la byas pa lan grangs gzhan la myong ba smin par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de dag med na tshe snga ma la byas pa lan grangs gzhan la myong ba smin par 'gyur ro //
translated: If none of these four types of karma exist, then karma done in a previous life that is to be experienced in another life will ripen.🔽The continuum of non-defiled karma is completely reversed.

original: nyon mongs pa can ma yin pa rnams kyis ni sems kyi rgyun gtan du log pa ste zhes bya ba ni dge ba dang ma bsgribs la lung du ma bstan pa rnams kyi'o //
analyzed: nyon mongs pa can ma yin pa rnams kyis ni sems kyi rgyun gtan du log pa ste zhes bya ba ni dge ba dang ma bsgribs la lung du ma bstan pa rnams kyi'o //
translated: This refers to virtuous and unobscured indeterminate karma.

original: rnam par 'drul ba'i khyad par las skyes pa zhes bya ba ni sa dang chu dang 'brel pa las 'bras bu'i rnam par 'gyur ba phra mo ni rnam par 'drul ba'o //
analyzed: rnam par 'drul ba'i khyad par las skyes pa zhes bya ba ni sa dang chu dang 'brel pa las 'bras bu'i rnam par 'gyur ba phra mo ni rnam par 'drul ba'o //
translated: The specific transformation is the subtle transformation of the effect due to the connection with earth and water.

original: de'i @319b khyad par ni de nyid khyad par can yin te /
analyzed: de'i @319b khyad par ni de nyid khyad par can yin te /
translated: The specific transformation is the transformation itself.

original: de la rnam par 'gyur ba'i khyad par skye ba 'am /
analyzed: de la rnam par 'gyur ba'i khyad par skye ba 'am /
translated: The effect arises from that specific transformation.

original: de las 'bras bu gzhan skye'o //
analyzed: de las 'bras bu gzhan skye'o //
translated: Or, another effect arises from that.

original: rnam par 'gyur ba'i khyad par ji lta bu zhig las yin pa bstan pa'i phyir de la 'byung ba'i rnam par 'gyur ba myu gu grub par byed pa gang yin pa de ni de'i sa bon yin zhes bya ba smos te ;
analyzed: rnam par 'gyur ba'i khyad par ji lta bu zhig las yin pa bstan pa'i phyir de la 'byung ba'i rnam par 'gyur ba myu gu grub par byed pa gang yin pa de ni de'i sa bon yin zhes bya ba smos te ;
translated: In order to demonstrate what kind of specific transformation it is, he says: The specific transformation of the elements that produces the established sprout is its seed.

original: myu gu de'i sa bon yin no //
analyzed: myu gu de'i sa bon yin no //
translated: It is the seed of that sprout.

original: 'byung ba'i rnam pa gzhan ma yin te /
analyzed: 'byung ba'i rnam pa gzhan ma yin te /
translated: It is not another form of the elements.

original: sngon gyi sa bon gyi gnas skabs kyi 'byung ba'i rnam pa ni ma yin no zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: sngon gyi sa bon gyi gnas skabs kyi 'byung ba'i rnam pa ni ma yin no zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: The meaning is that it is not the form of the elements in the previous state of the seed.

original: 'gyur ba'i ming gis zhes bya ba ni ji ltar phye 'thag go zhes 'byung ba ni 'gyur ba'i ming gi tha snyad 'dogs pa de bzhin du rgyud snga ma sa bon gyi gnas skabs ma rul ba las yang 'byung bar 'gyur ba'i ming gi sa bon zhes bya'o
analyzed: 'gyur ba'i ming gis zhes bya ba ni ji ltar phye 'thag go zhes 'byung ba ni 'gyur ba'i ming gi tha snyad 'dogs pa de bzhin du rgyud snga ma sa bon gyi gnas skabs ma rul ba las yang 'byung bar 'gyur ba'i ming gi sa bon zhes bya'o
translated: “The name is applied by way of transformation” means that just as the name “flour” is applied by way of transformation, the name “seed” is applied to the former continuum that is the basis of the seed that has not yet decayed, since it is the source of what arises.

original: // 'dra ba'i phyir zhes bya ba ni rgyun snga ma de yang 'byung ba rnam par 'gyur ba'i khyad par rnam par 'gyur ba las skye ba dang 'dra ba'i phyir sa bon zhes bya'o //
analyzed: // 'dra ba'i phyir zhes bya ba ni rgyun snga ma de yang 'byung ba rnam par 'gyur ba'i khyad par rnam par 'gyur ba las skye ba dang 'dra ba'i phyir sa bon zhes bya'o //
translated: “Because it is similar” means that the former continuum is called a seed because it is similar to the seed that arises from the transformation of the specific transformation of the elements.

original: de bzhin du 'di la yang zhes bya ba rgyas par 'byung ba ni gal te dam pa'i chos mnyan pa dang tshul bzhin yid la byed pa'i rkyen gyi khyad par las skyes pa dge ba zag pa dang bcas pa'i sems kyi 'gyur ba skye ba 'am /
analyzed: de bzhin du 'di la yang zhes bya ba rgyas par 'byung ba ni gal te dam pa'i chos mnyan pa dang tshul bzhin yid la byed pa'i rkyen gyi khyad par las skyes pa dge ba zag pa dang bcas pa'i sems kyi 'gyur ba skye ba 'am /
translated: “So too, here” means that if a virtuous mind that is contaminated arises from the specific condition of listening to the true Dharma and properly contemplating it, then the name “seed” is applied to it because it is similar to the seed that arises from the specific transformation of the elements.

original: dam pa ma yin pa'i chos mnyan pa dang / tshul bzhin ma yin pa'i yid la byed pa'i rkyen gyi khyad par las skyes pa mi dge ba'i sems kyi 'gyur ba skye na /
analyzed: dam pa ma yin pa'i chos mnyan pa dang / tshul bzhin ma yin pa'i yid la byed pa'i rkyen gyi khyad par las skyes pa mi dge ba'i sems kyi 'gyur ba skye na /
translated: When a transformation of a nonvirtuous mind arises from the special condition of listening to a non-sacred teaching and improper attention,

original: de las rnam par smin pa gzhan skye'i /
analyzed: de las rnam par smin pa gzhan skye'i /
translated: another karmic maturation arises from that.

original: gzhan du ni ma yin pas de ni mtshungs so //
analyzed: gzhan du ni ma yin pas de ni mtshungs so //
translated: It is similar to the case of a seed.

original: ji ltar 'bras bu kho na las 'bras bu gzhan mi 'byung gi //
analyzed: ji ltar 'bras bu kho na las 'bras bu gzhan mi 'byung gi //
translated: Just as a result does not arise from a result,🔽but rather from a transformation of the seed,

original: 'o na ci zhe na 'gyur ba'i khyad par las yin pa de bzhin du rnam par smin pa kho na las rnam par smin pa gzhan mi 'byung gi /🔽'o na ci zhe na /
analyzed: 'o na ci zhe na 'gyur ba'i khyad par las yin pa de bzhin du rnam par smin pa kho na las rnam par smin pa gzhan mi 'byung gi / 'o na ci zhe na /
translated: so too, a karmic maturation does not arise from a karmic maturation,

original: sems kyi 'gyur ba'i khyad par las 'byung bas de ni mtshungs so //
analyzed: sems kyi 'gyur ba'i khyad par las 'byung bas de ni mtshungs so //
translated: but rather from a transformation of the mind.

original: 'bras bu ni nang du ge sar dmar po zhes bya ba ni 'bras bu'i nang du gan bi dza pu ra'i khu ba skyur po yod pa'i ge sar ro //
analyzed: 'bras bu ni nang du ge sar dmar po zhes bya ba ni 'bras bu'i nang du gan bi dza pu ra'i khu ba skyur po yod pa'i ge sar ro //
translated: The inner red stamen is the stamen of the pomegranate that is sour to the taste.

original: de las ni gzhan mi skye'o zhes bya ba 'byung ngo ;
analyzed: de las ni gzhan mi skye'o zhes bya ba 'byung ngo ;
translated: From that, another does not arise.

original: /'di ni 'dir dper brjod pa yin te /
analyzed: /'di ni 'dir dper brjod pa yin te /
translated: This is an example.

original: ji ltar rgya skyegs kyis kha bsgyur ba'i ma du lud ga'i me tog gi 'bras bu ge sar dmar po las slar ge sar dmar po gzhan mi 'byung ba de bzhin du las las skyes pa'i rnam par smin pa las rnam par smin pa gzhan mi skye'o //
analyzed: ji ltar rgya skyegs kyis kha bsgyur ba'i ma du lud ga'i me tog gi 'bras bu ge sar dmar po las slar ge sar dmar po gzhan mi 'byung ba de bzhin du las las skyes pa'i rnam par smin pa las rnam par smin pa gzhan mi skye'o //
translated: Just as a red lac dye does not produce another red lac dye from a red lac flower, so too, a karmic maturation does not produce another karmic maturation.

original: 'dir smas pa /🔽sems 'di sa bon @320a * //
analyzed: 'dir smas pa / sems 'di sa bon @320a * //
translated: Here it is said:

original: mtha' yas pa dang lhan cig rgyun gyis 'byung //
analyzed: mtha' yas pa dang lhan cig rgyun gyis 'byung //
translated: This mind arises in a continuum with infinite seeds.

original: sa bon de de rang rkyen byung na sems la rgyas par 'gyur //
analyzed: sa bon de de rang rkyen byung na sems la rgyas par 'gyur //
translated: When those seeds are produced by their own conditions, the mind expands.

original: de rgyas rim gyis 'jug pa rnyed na dus su 'bras ster 'grub //
analyzed: de rgyas rim gyis 'jug pa rnyed na dus su 'bras ster 'grub //
translated: When that expansion gradually reaches its limit, it produces the fruit at the right time.

original: ma du lung ga'i me tog bskus tshon de yi ge sar bzhin //
analyzed: ma du lung ga'i me tog bskus tshon de yi ge sar bzhin //
translated: Like a lac flower smeared with red lac dye.

original: yang smras pa /
analyzed: yang smras pa /
translated: Again it is said:🔽Just as from a cotton seed

original: ji ltar ras bal sa bon dang // mu du lung ga'i me tog la //
analyzed: ji ltar ras bal sa bon dang // mu du lung ga'i me tog la //
translated: and a lac flower,

original: rgya skyegs bskus na de zhig kyang //
analyzed: rgya skyegs bskus na de zhig kyang //
translated: the lac dye is produced.

original: bsgos pa'i rgyun gyi rim pa yis //
analyzed: bsgos pa'i rgyun gyi rim pa yis //
translated: By the process of the continuity of the dye,

original: ras bal dang ni ge sar la //
analyzed: ras bal dang ni ge sar la //
translated: the cotton and the flower

original: dmar po 'byung bar 'gyur ba ltar //
analyzed: dmar po 'byung bar 'gyur ba ltar //
translated: just as a red color will appear from a red flower.

original: las rnams zhig na 'ang bsgos pa ni //
analyzed: las rnams zhig na 'ang bsgos pa ni //
translated: Even when the action has ceased, the imprint

original: de nyid de yi 'bras bu skyed //🔽las dang de'i bsgos pa zhes bya ba 'byung la //
analyzed: de nyid de yi 'bras bu skyed // las dang de'i bsgos pa zhes bya ba 'byung la //
translated: of that action will produce its effect.🔽The imprint of that action is the imprint of the action.

original: de'i bsgos pa zhes bya ba ni las kyis bsgos pa'o //
analyzed: de'i bsgos pa zhes bya ba ni las kyis bsgos pa'o //
translated: The imprint of that action is the imprint of the action.

analyzed: bsgos pa de'i 'jug pa rnyed pa ste /

original: 'jug pa rnyed pa de las 'bras bu ste /
analyzed: 'jug pa rnyed pa de las 'bras bu ste /
translated: From the acquisition of the entry of the imprint, the effect arises.

original: bzhi po de dag ni sangs rgyas las gzhan pa nyan thos la sogs pas rnam pa thams cad de /🔽rnam pa kun nges par 'dod rgyal du rab tu mi shes so /
analyzed: bzhi po de dag ni sangs rgyas las gzhan pa nyan thos la sogs pas rnam pa thams cad de / rnam pa kun nges par 'dod rgyal du rab tu mi shes so /
translated: These four are not known by anyone other than the Buddha, the Sravakas, etc.,🔽in any way whatsoever.

analyzed: don gyis na sangs rgyas kho nas de thams cad rnam pa thams cad du rab tu mkhyen to zhes bshad pa yin no //
translated: The meaning is that the Buddha alone knows all of that in every way.

original: de ltar zhes bya ba rgyas par 'byung ba la /
analyzed: de ltar zhes bya ba rgyas par 'byung ba la /
translated: As for the phrase “in that way,”

analyzed: de ltar zhes bya ba'i sgra ni yongs su rdzogs pa'i don to //
translated: the word “that” has the sense of completion.

analyzed: sangs rgyas bdag med pa gsungs pa rnams kyi gsung rab chos nyid mthong na ste mthong bar 'gyur nas so // rigs pa'i lam ni tshul te /
translated: The scriptures of the Buddha, who has taught selflessness, are pure, i.e., they are seen to be reality.🔽The path of reasoning is the method.

original: gtan tshigs kyi lam mo //
analyzed: gtan tshigs kyi lam mo //
translated: The path of reasoning is the path of logic.

original: des dag pa ni rigs pa'i lam legs par gsungs pas dag pa'o //
analyzed: des dag pa ni rigs pa'i lam legs par gsungs pas dag pa'o //
translated: By that, they are pure, i.e., they are purified by the well-spoken path of reasoning.

original: legs par gsungs shing mdzes par gsungs pa ni legs par gsungs pa'o //
analyzed: legs par gsungs shing mdzes par gsungs pa ni legs par gsungs pa'o //
translated: Well-spoken and beautifully spoken are well-spoken.

original: mu stegs dag ni yang dag pa ji lta ba mthong ba med pas long ba dag go //
analyzed: mu stegs dag ni yang dag pa ji lta ba mthong ba med pas long ba dag go //
translated: The tīrthikas are blind because they do not see reality as it is.

original: long ba lta ngan sna tshogs g-yo rnams kyi //
analyzed: long ba lta ngan sna tshogs g-yo rnams kyi //
translated: The blind, with their various false views and deceptions,

original: zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: zhes bya ba la /
translated: In this verse,

original: lta ngan ni lta ba smad pa'o //
analyzed: lta ngan ni lta ba smad pa'o //
translated: false views are inferior views.

original: lta ba ngan pa yang yin la /🔽g-yo ba yang yin pa ni lta ngan sna tshogs g-yo ba rnams so //
analyzed: lta ba ngan pa yang yin la / g-yo ba yang yin pa ni lta ngan sna tshogs g-yo ba rnams so //
translated: They are inferior views and🔽deceptions are false views and deceptions.

original: gang dag la lta ba ngan pa sna tshogs g-yo ba yod pa de dag ni lta ngan sna tshogs g-yo rnams te /
analyzed: gang dag la lta ba ngan pa sna tshogs g-yo ba yod pa de dag ni lta ngan sna tshogs g-yo rnams te /
translated: Those who have various false views and deceptions are those with various false views and deceptions.

original: sems can lta ba ngan pa rnam pa sna tshogs g-yo ba can mtho ris dang byang grol gyi lam la ma zhugs pa dang / log pa la zhugs pa de rnams so zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: sems can lta ba ngan pa rnam pa sna tshogs g-yo ba can mtho ris dang byang grol gyi lam la ma zhugs pa dang / log pa la zhugs pa de rnams so zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: The meaning is: those sentient beings who are unstable with various bad views, who have not entered the path to the higher realms and liberation, and who have entered the wrong path.

original: long ba ma yin pa rnams ni mu stegs ser skya ba dang / 'ug pa pa la sogs pa de lta bu de dag gi gzhung @320b lugs sam /
analyzed: long ba ma yin pa rnams ni mu stegs ser skya ba dang / 'ug pa pa la sogs pa de lta bu de dag gi gzhung @320b lugs sam /
translated: Those who are not blind are the non-Buddhists such as the Sāṃkhyas, Ājīvikas, and Nirgranthas.

original: lta ba spangs shing bor nas 'khor ba nas mya ngan las 'das par 'gro'o //
analyzed: lta ba spangs shing bor nas 'khor ba nas mya ngan las 'das par 'gro'o //
translated: Having abandoned and rejected their scriptures or views, they go from saṃsāra to nirvāṇa.

original: long ba ma yin pa de dag gang zhe na /
analyzed: long ba ma yin pa de dag gang zhe na /
translated: Who are those who are not blind?

original: 'phags pa nyan thos shes rab kyi mig dang ldan pa rnams so //
analyzed: 'phags pa nyan thos shes rab kyi mig dang ldan pa rnams so //
translated: The noble śrāvakas who possess the eye of wisdom.

original: yang na gsung rab kyi chos nyid de kho na la bsgrub po zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: yang na gsung rab kyi chos nyid de kho na la bsgrub po zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: Or else, they establish themselves in the reality of the scriptures. This is the meaning.

original: gsung rab kyi chos nyid ni 'dir bdag med pa'am /
analyzed: gsung rab kyi chos nyid ni 'dir bdag med pa'am /
translated: The reality of the scriptures here is selflessness,

original: sangs rgyas kyi rjes su bstan pa'o //
analyzed: sangs rgyas kyi rjes su bstan pa'o //
translated: or the teaching of the Buddha.

original: gzhan dag na re gsung rab mdo sde la sogs pa gsung rab kyi yan lag bcu gnyis su gtogs pa'o //
analyzed: gzhan dag na re gsung rab mdo sde la sogs pa gsung rab kyi yan lag bcu gnyis su gtogs pa'o //
translated: According to another opinion, the good law is the twelve membered scriptures, Sutras, etc.

original: de'i chos nyid ni rigs pa dang ldan pa'i phyir legs par gsungs pa nyid dang / mya ngan las 'das pa brjod pa'i phyir mya ngan las 'das pa la gzhol ba nyid yin no //
analyzed: de'i chos nyid ni rigs pa dang ldan pa'i phyir legs par gsungs pa nyid dang / mya ngan las 'das pa brjod pa'i phyir mya ngan las 'das pa la gzhol ba nyid yin no //
translated: It is well spoken because it is in conformity with reason; it tends toward Nirvana because it proclaims Nirvana.

original: ji ltar mya ngan la 'das pa la gzhol bar 'gyur zhe na /
analyzed: ji ltar mya ngan la 'das pa la gzhol bar 'gyur zhe na /
translated: How does it tend toward Nirvana?

original: mi rtag par 'du shes pa la bdag med pa'i 'du shes gnas la bdag med par 'du shes pa la mya ngan las 'das pa la zhi bar 'du shes pa gnas te /
analyzed: mi rtag par 'du shes pa la bdag med pa'i 'du shes gnas la bdag med par 'du shes pa la mya ngan las 'das pa la zhi bar 'du shes pa gnas te /
translated: The idea of impermanence is based on the idea of nonself; the idea of nonself is based on the idea of calm Nirvana.

original: de la skrag ba med pa'i phyir ro //🔽mya ngan las 'das pa zhi bar 'du shes pa la /
analyzed: de la skrag ba med pa'i phyir ro // mya ngan las 'das pa zhi bar 'du shes pa la /
translated: Because one is not afraid of Nirvana.🔽The idea of calm Nirvana is based on the idea of the impermanence of the aggregates.🔽The idea of the impermanence of the aggregates is based on the idea of the nonself of the aggregates.

original: rgyud de la gzhol ba gnas so //
analyzed: rgyud de la gzhol ba gnas so //
translated: The idea of the nonself of the aggregates is based on the idea of the suffering of the aggregates.🔽The idea of the suffering of the aggregates is based on the idea of the impurity of the aggregates.🔽The idea of the impurity of the aggregates is based on the idea of the body as food.🔽The idea of the body as food is based on the idea of the body as impure.🔽The idea of the body as impure is based on the idea of the body as a source of affliction.🔽The idea of the body as a source of affliction is based on the idea of the body as impermanent.🔽The idea of the body as impermanent is based on the idea of the body as not self.🔽The idea of the body as not self is based on the idea of the body as calm.🔽The idea of the body as calm is based on the idea of the body as pleasant.

original: gzhan yang bdag mi rtag par 'du shes pa ni srid pa dang mi mthun par 'gyur ba yin te /
analyzed: gzhan yang bdag mi rtag par 'du shes pa ni srid pa dang mi mthun par 'gyur ba yin te /
translated: The idea of the body as pleasant is based on the idea of the body as mine.🔽The idea of the body as mine is based on the idea of the body as a self.🔽The idea of the body as a self is based on the idea of the body as a living being.🔽The idea of the body as a living being is based on the idea of the body as a person.🔽The idea of the body as a person is based on the idea of the body as a human being.🔽The idea of the body as a human being is based on the idea of the body as a man.🔽The idea of the body as a man is based on the idea of the body as a woman.🔽The idea of the body as a woman is based on the idea of the body as a being of the three unfortunate planes of existence.🔽The idea of the body as a being of the three unfortunate planes of existence

original: nyes pa dang bcas pa dang blo bur bar khong du chud pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: nyes pa dang bcas pa dang blo bur bar khong du chud pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because they understand that it is flawed and adventitious.

original: mya ngan la 'das pa la zhi bar 'du shes pas de dang mthun par 'gyur te /
analyzed: mya ngan la 'das pa la zhi bar 'du shes pas de dang mthun par 'gyur te /
translated: They have the notion of peace with regard to nirvana, and so they are in accord with it,

original: de'i nges par 'byung pa nyid du khong du chud pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de'i nges par 'byung pa nyid du khong du chud pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because they understand it to be the very escape from samsara.

original: ji skad du /
analyzed: ji skad du /
translated: As it is said:

original: chos 'di dag thams cad mya ngan las 'das pa la gzhol ba /
analyzed: chos 'di dag thams cad mya ngan las 'das pa la gzhol ba /
translated: All these dharmas lead to nirvana,

original: mya ngan las 'das pa la 'bab pa /
analyzed: mya ngan las 'das pa la 'bab pa /
translated: flow to nirvana,

original: mya ngan las 'das pa la bab pa ste /
analyzed: mya ngan las 'das pa la bab pa ste /
translated: tend to nirvana,

original: mngon par brjod pa na mya ngan las 'das pa kho na mngon par brjod pa'o zhes gsungs pa lta bu'o zhes zer ro //
analyzed: mngon par brjod pa na mya ngan las 'das pa kho na mngon par brjod pa'o zhes gsungs pa lta bu'o zhes zer ro //
translated: and when they are expressed, they are expressed in terms of nirvana.

original: de'i phyir de ltar na long ba ma yin pa rnams kho na 'gro'i //
analyzed: de'i phyir de ltar na long ba ma yin pa rnams kho na 'gro'i //
translated: Thus, only the non-blind go,

analyzed: long ba rnams ni ma yin no //

analyzed: long ba rnams ni bdag med pa mthong bas 'khor ba'i rgya mtshor 'khyams pa nyid do //
translated: The blind wander in the ocean of samsara because they see no self.

original: de bstan pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de bstan pa'i phyir ro //
translated: This is taught.

original: de bzhin gshegs pa zhes bya ba rgyas par smos so //
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa zhes bya ba rgyas par smos so //
translated: The Tathāgata is so called because he has thus gone.🔽

original: de bzhin gshegs pa nyid nyi ma yin pas de bzhin gshegs pa nyi ma ste /
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa nyid nyi ma yin pas de bzhin gshegs pa nyi ma ste /
translated: The Tathāgata is the sun, because he is the Tathāgata, i.e., the sun.

original: chos zab mo mngon par rab tu ston pa'i phyir nyi ma yin no //
analyzed: chos zab mo mngon par rab tu ston pa'i phyir nyi ma yin no //
translated: He is the sun because he illuminates the profound Dharma.

original: ji ltar zhe na /
analyzed: ji ltar zhe na /
translated: How so?

original: gnyen po'i khyad par dang / sku gzugs kyi khyad par dang / 'od zer gyi khyad par dang / yul gyi khyad par gyis so //
analyzed: gnyen po'i khyad par dang / sku gzugs kyi khyad par dang / 'od zer gyi khyad par dang / yul gyi khyad par gyis so //
